fields.name: CHAIRMAN’S REMARKS
fields.summary: There has been a Cambrian explosion in InsureTech in the last 12 months, but key questions remain about how InsurTechs will create step-change and how incumbents will respond

fields.name: AGE OF DISRUPTION
fields.summary: Technological advances are starting to transform insurance, while the nature of risk is changing as well – incumbents, InsurTechs, and investors all need to think bigger and more broadly to address these changes

fields.name: DRIVEN TO INNOVATION
fields.summary: The auto (and auto insurance) industry is going to change over the next decade, which will require new products – up-and-coming InsurTechs should develop their core capabilities and establish their DNA early on

fields.name: DRIVEN UNDERWRITING FROM 350,000 FEET AND BEYOND
fields.summary: Orbital Insight is using satellite imagery and machine learning to translate analytics and AI approaches currently used by hedge funds into insurance solutions

fields.name: A VIEW FROM THE C-SUITE
fields.summary: Future success in insurance will require increased customer centricity, leveraging strategy, structure, and staffing to solve customer problems.

fields.name: EMBRACING CHANGE
fields.summary: Insurance has an amazing social mission it is short of fulfilling and needs to change and innovate in order not to slow down human progress

fields.summary: TKTK

fields.name: REDEFINING THE INSURANCE VALUE PROPOSITION

fields.summary: The insurance company of the future will have to evolve from passively transferring risk to being an active risk shield

fields.summary: TKTK

fields.name: VR IN INSURANCE: A WORLD’S FIRST
fields.summary: TKTK

fields.name: IT ALL STARTS WITH TALENT
fields.summary: The insurance industry needs to use the opportunity of InsureTech to attract and retain a talented and diverse workforce

fields.name: THE DIGITAL INSURER: INEVITABLE CHANGES HAVE ALREADY BEGUN
fields.summary: Changes are coming to the incumbent’s value chain: new tech stacks for innovation, transformation of the agent, increased focus on knowing the customer, and specialized providers for most functions and services.

fields.name: MAXIMIZING PROFITABILITY VIA PRODUCT AND BUSINESS MODEL INNOVATION
fields.summary: The key to maximizing profitability is changing your mindset to consider new products and distribution channels that allow you access new markets and enable auxiliary product sales.

fields.name: INSURERS AND INSURETECH
fields.summary: In the age of InsureTech, insurers are focusing on data, pace of deployment, and how best to innovate rapidly.

fields.name: IN THE CMO’S SUITE: DRIVING GROWTH AMIDST ALL OF THE CHAOS AND INNOVATION
fields.summary: The mandate for CMOs is rapidly shifting to data, analytics, and customer experience.

fields.name: HYPE VERSUS IMPACT
fields.summary: The insurance industry of the future will look significantly different in how capital and risk are connected; insurers will need to adapt their operating models to retool for this era

fields.name: FROM MVP TO POC
fields.summary: Clear communication and proactive effort in the sales process is essential to a successful partnership between start-ups and corporates

fields.name: INNOVATION SHOWCASE
fields.summary: WeGoLook, Lapetus, Plumis, and Tomorrow showcase their business models and discuss what it took to be successful

fields.name: PRACTICAL APPLICATION OF DRONES
fields.summary: The combination of emerging software that unlocks drone value and declining hardware costs is creating more practical applications of drones

fields.name: INNOVATION SHOWCASE
fields.summary: Kespry, Galaxy.ai, Teambrella, and Flo showcase their business models and discuss what it took to be successful

fields.name: INSURETECH: BY THE NUMBERS
fields.summary: InsureTech innovation and deal activity continue to trend upward, and incumbents are building, buying, and partnering to stay relevant

fields.name: INNOVATION SHOWCASE
fields.summary: The Zebra, Harvesting, Open Data Nation, and Blueprint Income showcase their business models and discuss what it took to be successful

fields.name: FUNDING THE FUTURE
fields.summary: VCs discuss the difficulty of managing the difference in pace between InsurTechs and incumbents

fields.name: THE PATHWAYS OF INNOVATION
fields.summary: InsurTechs can translate ideas to impact by combining incremental improvements with transformational ideas

fields.name: THE ART OF THE DEAL
fields.summary: Making a deal requires quick adaptation and navigation of incumbent politics

fields.name: SIMPLER, SMARTER, FASTER: A FIRESIDE CHAT
fields.summary: AXA is actively changing their approach to innovation, internally as well as through external partnerships and acquisitions

fields.name: WINNING PARTNERSHIPS: A FIRESIDE CHAT
fields.summary: Ring is focused on building a brand and improving people’s lives more than growth and business development

fields.name: THE SHIFTING LANDSCAPE OF RISK
fields.summary: AIG is betting big on new types of risk, from cyber to autonomous cars

fields.name: BREAKING NEWS III
fields.summary: Three InsurTechs discuss their recent major announcements

fields.name: BLOCKCHAIN: ONE YEAR LATER
fields.summary: A  year ago, blockchain was presented as the new face of insurance. A year later, not much has changed, and blockchain is only making strides in a few specific cases - successful companies are the ones bringing POCs or concrete use cases to investors

fields.name: THE COGNITIVE FORCE IS STRONG WITH THIS IOT DEMO
fields.summary: AI has multiple applications in insurance, from chatbots for customer service to conversational commerce with virtual agents and employee productivity enhancement

fields.name: BALANCING INNOVATION AND REGULATION
fields.summary: InsurTechs should engage their regulators now because regulators want to understand and use the latest tech, while also helping you understand potential pitfalls

fields.name: INNOVATION SHOWCASE
fields.summary: InsurTechs from around the globe shared their solutions to improve customer experience, digitize and reinvent sales and delivery, and equip agents and brokers with new and powerful technology

fields.name: THE MODERN MARTECH GROWTH STACK
fields.summary: Today, enhanced marketing capabilities, including targeting and automation, are available to insurers, which they must implement to sell effectively

fields.name: PRACTICAL APPLICATION OF AI AND MACHINE LEARNING
fields.summary: AI has broad applications in Life and P&C, but challenges remain around acquiring talent, data access, and data quality

fields.name: TRACTION AND SCALE
fields.summary: In gaining traction and scale, keys to success are good partnerships with carriers, picking the right team, and not biting off more than you can chew

fields.name: ML AUTOMATION: HOW AI DRIVES YOUR ANALYTICS STRATEGY
fields.summary: Both ML and AI are necessary for the insurance industry to be able to create and update the vast numbers of predictive models that will be needed in the future

fields.name: ACHIEVING GROWTH IN HEALTH INSURANCE & MEDICARE
fields.summary: Spiraling ACA premium costs are driving a migration toward alternative non-ACA compliant healthcare products

fields.name: HEALTHTECH: BENEFITS INNOVATION
fields.summary: Despite regulatory hurdles, the benefits tech ecosystem will continue to evolve, primarily driven by employer demands

fields.name: CONNECTED HEALTH: KEEPING HEALTH INSURERS RELEVANT
fields.summary: Health insurers can utilize IoT to better select risk, control losses, and price more effectively

fields.name: LIFE INSURANCE SUPPLY CHAIN
fields.summary: Adoption of accelerated underwriting has increased significantly even in the past year, improving customer experiences, sales economics, and marketing opportunities

fields.name: UNDERWRITING 2.0: OPENING PANDORA’S BOX IN LIFE
fields.summary: Advanced underwriting methods, whether via big data, epigenetics or other methods are changing the nature of risk selection and pricing; however the specific methods which will “win out” are still unclear

fields.name: SO YOU WANT TO BE AN INSUR(E)TECH
fields.summary: Starting an InsurTech is difficult, owing to many factors, including the need for regulatory capital and that the system is designed to service incumbents

fields.name: THE FUTURE OF MOBILITY: AT THE ONRAMP OF AUTONOMY
fields.summary: Sensors and autonomous features in vehicles are already here and reducing risk - insurers not thinking through the related issues are already behind

fields.name: CULTURE OF INNOVATION
fields.summary: It is difficult to introduce a culture of innovation in large insurance companies, and it cannot come straight from the top: operational layers need to get on board and have to understand why the change is happening

fields.name: BUILDING AN INNOVATION ECOSYSTEM
fields.summary: Innovation has to be focused on the right hypotheses and be measured / treated differently from the rest of the business at first to be successful; return on learning is more important than return on investment

fields.name: REIMAGINING THE CUSTOMER JOURNEY
fields.summary: The customer journey typically centers on “moments of truth,” and carriers need to leverage data to ensure the best experience during these key moments

fields.name: REINVENTING THE CORE FOR A NEW AGE OF INSURANCE
fields.summary: To reinvent the core of insurance, either start a greenfield operation or develop a culture of constant change to get people accustomed to it

fields.name: IT’S ALL ABOUT RESULTS
fields.summary: To successfully partner with insurers, startups must have a concise, concrete, and well-defined value proposition

fields.name: PRACTICAL APPLICATION OF INTERNET OF THINGS
fields.summary: IoT utilization will continue to gain traction and impact as the data produced becomes more actuarially credible and customer adoption increases

fields.name: BUILD, BUY OR PARTNER: INSURER CASE STUDIES
fields.summary: Partnerships are vital to augment expertise in non-core areas, while building and buying is best suited for mission critical areas

fields.name: CLAIMS REIMAGINED: HOW TECH CAN BE LEVERAGED TO RE-CONNECT THE DOTS
fields.summary: Insurers will need to marry their historical claims expertise to emerging technologies in order to meet evolving customer expectations

fields.name: TELEMATICS UNLOCKED: THE DONGLE AND BEYOND
fields.summary: Telematics’ value is twofold: in better pricing policies and changing customer behavior via immediate feedback

fields.name: THE FUTURE OF DISTRIBUTION
fields.summary: Brokers will need to shift to higher-value roles as channel experts as products become commoditized

fields.name: INNOVATION IN COMMERCIAL INSURANCE
fields.summary: Innovation may have started in personal lines, but it is expanding to commercial lines as well, particularly in the small business segment

fields.name: MISSION IMPOSSIBLE: CALCULATING CYBER RISK
fields.summary: Cyber insurance is rapidly evolving, but there are still significant data limitations, and it must be integrated with security practices to be successful

fields.name: CSAA INSURANCE GROUP, A AAA INSURANCE
NAVEEN AGARWAL
fields.title: CHIEF CUSTOMER OFFICER
fields.details: Naveen Agarwal is responsible for driving Prudential’s customer experience and engagement strategies to deliver economic returns and expanded capabilities to the company. Prior to Prudential, Naveen was CEO of Pricelock, a startup helping energy professionals to hedge and transact physical energy contracts, and President of E*TRADE Capital Management where he managed E*TRADE’s retirement, mutual fund, wealth management, lending, and corporate stock plan business. Naveen holds an MBA from Haas School of Business, UC Berkeley, CA and Bachelors in Computer Science & Engineering from IT-BHU, Varanasi, India.

fields.name: HUSSEIN AL BAYA
fields.title: PRINCIPAL
fields.details: Hussein is a Principal at Sageview Capital, a growth equity firm founded by two former partners at KKR and that has raised over $2bn since inception.  Hussein leads the firm’s investment efforts in the financial services and financial technology sectors.  Previously, he was on the investment teams at Valinor Management, Bain Capital Credit, and Goldman Sachs’ Principal Investment Area.  Hussein is an honors graduate of Carnegie Mellon University and holds an MBA from Harvard Business School.

fields.name: DREW ALDRICH
fields.title: PRINCIPAL
fields.details: Drew is the NY based Principal at American Family Ventures, a $200m Venture Capital firm backed by American Family Insurance.  He was previously a Senior Associate with AXA Strategic Ventures, a fund he helped build while in the Strategy & M&A team at AXA. Drew has a deep finance background and has led publicly traded restructurings, capital raising and partnership negotiations on three continents and was the Founder of CalendarFly.com a NY based ed-tech startup.

fields.name: A.J. ALTMAN
fields.title: FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: A.J. Altman is Founder & CEO of HOVER, a 3D software company based in San Francisco. Prior to founding HOVER, A.J. was an infantry officer in the United States Marine Corps. He began his career as an engineer at Intel Corporation. A.J. is a graduate of the University of Notre Dame.

fields.name: SAEED AMIDI
fields.title: FOUNDER AND CEO
fields.details: Saeed has been a technology investor since 1998 and co-founded Amidzad with Pejman and Rahim in 1999. He has been closely involved with many new emerging growth companies, including 3 investments with over $1B valuation: Paypal (acquired by eBay), Lending Club (IPO, Dec 2014) and DropBox. Saeed founded Plug and Play, the ultimate startup ecosystem, in 2006. Saeed is an active member of the tech community and a frequent contributor to numerous charitable foundations.

fields.name: JANET ANDERSON
fields.title: CHIEF MARKETING OFFICER
fields.details: With over 25 years experience in developing and building businesses for major global insurance marketing organizations in Europe, Latin America and North America, Janet is responsible for bringing our revolutionary approach to life event prediction to market through branding, messaging and business development activities. She received her BA from University of Wisconsin-LaCrosse and her XMBA from Loyola College.

fields.name: DUNCAN ANDERSON
fields.title: GLOBAL LEADER, INSURANCE TECHNOLOGY
fields.details: Duncan is Global Leader, Insurance Technology at Willis Towers Watson. He specialises in personal lines pricing and related software and has worked with most of the UK’s main insurers and major multinational insurance groups. He steers the development of market leading insurance technology and software solutions used by insurers globally for the pricing, claims, underwriting, reserving and capital management. He also heads the Advanced Analytics function within the Company.

fields.name: JASON ANDREW
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Recognizing the early trend for insurtech innovation in 2013, Jason co-founded Limelight Health to deliver better data integration and sales efficiency for insurance carriers, PEO’s, brokers and others in the employee benefits ecosystem. Limelight’s award-winning technology, QuotePad™, aims to transform the way health insurance and employee benefits are quoted, sold and renewed. Jason is a serial entrepreneur advising numerous Silicon Valley startups, also volunteering in the industry/community.

fields.name: SHARON ASHTON
fields.title: SVP COMMERCIAL AUTOMOBILE
fields.details: Sharon Ashton has been with the Chubb for 31 years.  Sharon has a BA in Economics with a minor in Computer Science from Lafayette College Easton, Pennsylvania.  Sharon joined Chubb’s Information Technology department in 1986 as a programmer.  She has been involved in the design, build and implementation of Commercial Lines applications at Chubb and has managed both technical and business analysis teams.

fields.name: JOSH AYCOCK
fields.title: PRINCIPAL
fields.details: Josh Aycock is a Principal and founding member at American Family Ventures, the venture capital arm of Fortune 500 property and casualty insurer American Family Insurance, where he is focused on sourcing and evaluating investment opportunities, structuring deals, and supporting the firm’s portfolio companies. Josh currently serves on the Boards of Cozy; Hover; One, Inc.; and XOR Data Exchange. Prior to joining AFV in 2013, he worked for several years in health tech and disaster response, as well as in product roles at various startups. He holds an AB from Washington University in St. Louis, and an MBA and an MS in human-computer interaction from the University of Michigan.

fields.name: CHIP BACCIOCCO
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Charles “Chip” Bacciocco is the CEO of TrustedChoice.com, the nation's largest online marketing platform for independent insurance agents and IA insurance companies. Prior to joining TrustedChoice.com in 2012, Chip served in multiple roles over his 30-year career in the insurance industry, including as COO of Aon Private Risk Management Services, Inc., Senior Vice President of Product Strategy at Zywave and Vice President of E-Business Application Development at Arthur J Gallagher & Co. Chip is a graduate of the University of Notre Dame and lives with his wife and children in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.

fields.name: GREGORY BAILEY
fields.title: CEO & CO-FOUNDER
fields.details: Gregory Bailey is the CEO & Co-Founder of Denim®, an insurtech company that is reimagining marketing and distribution with wicked smart technology. With more than 20 years of executive experience in the insurance industry, Gregory has led national marketing and sales teams at Northwestern Mutual, Mutual of Omaha, CUNA Mutual Group, Pacific Life and Athene. Gregory and the Denim team are excited to make a major product announcement at this year's conference!

fields.name: PARKER BARRILE
fields.title: PARTNER
fields.details: Parker Barrile is a Partner at Norwest Venture Partners. Prior to Norwest, he was CPO at Prosper, a marketplace lending company, and VP Product at LinkedIn, where he led a product org responsible for 80% of LinkedIn’s revenue. Earlier in his career, Parker founded a venture-backed startup and held strategy roles at Google and Bain & Company. Parker has served as an advisor to startups such as Medallia, Thumbtack, NerdWallet, Doximity, and Procore. He holds a BS in Math and an MBA, both from Stanford.

fields.name: CROOM BEATTY
fields.title: VENTURE INVESTOR
fields.details: Croom is an investor at Menlo Ventures where he focuses on investing in innovative financial technology and software companies. Prior to joining Menlo, he launched and ran Payoneer’s Early Payments business, offering working capital solutions to small businesses around the globe. Croom began his career as a growth-stage investor at Susquehanna Growth Equity where his investment experience includes companies like Credit Karma, Payoneer, and PaySimple.

fields.name: DR. JOHANNES BECHER
fields.title: FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: Johannes is the founder and CEO of the Berlin-based life insurance startup Getsurance. Before inventing the first digital disability insurance, he replicated existing business models such as Lending Club as an executive at Germany's super-incubator Rocket Internet. With a PhD in law and additional degrees in Management and Technology, Johannes excels in building products in highly regulated industries. He lives in Berlin-Kreuzberg and enjoys burgers and craft beer - which he pays in Bitcoin whenever possible.

fields.name: JILL BEGGS
fields.title: HEAD OF NEW STRATEGIC MARKETS
fields.details: Jill Beggs is Head of New Strategic Markets at Munich Reinsurance America, Inc. (Munich Re) managing the Innovation Practice, Corporate Communications and Cross-Platform Teams. Jill was previously Head of Specialty Lines Underwriting in the Reinsurance Division (RD) of Munich Re and an Innovation Point Person, responsible for understanding the Group’s innovation efforts. A graduate of Gettysburg College, Jill’s a Chartered Property and Casualty Underwriter and earned the Associate in Reinsurance designation.

fields.name: JASON BENNETT
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: With over 15 years of experience in direct response TV & radio advertising, Jason Bennett has created, managed and analyzed results-driven campaigns directly responsible for nine-digit call center sales. When he’s not creating schedules for call center advertisers, Jason enjoys fishing and coaching basketball.

fields.name: RUTH FOXE BLADER
fields.title: DIRECTOR, INVESTMENTS
fields.details: Ruth Foxe Blader is a Director at Anthemis. Prior to joining, she led venture investing in Insurtech and Asset Management at Allianz, where she spent more than 5 years bridging the gap between Allianz and the emerging technology ecosystem. Ruth has spent her entire career guiding digital transformation at Fortune 500 companies, previously leading PepsiCo’s global digital and social strategies, and running the European subsidiary of a New York digital agency.

fields.name: FARRON BLANC
fields.title: VP - INNOVATION STUDIO
fields.details:
Farron Blanc is VP, Innovation Studio at RGAx, Reinsurance Group of America’s, incubator. His expertise in product development, and growth, derive from years in developed and emerging insurance markets. He is a partner at SixThirty, a FinTech VC fund, and a mentor at the Global Insurance Accelerator. He was named one of the 20 Insurance Innovators to know by Digital Insurance, and one of the top 35 young executives by Intelligent Insurer in 2017.
.

fields.name: JULIE BLANC
fields.title: TEAM MEMBER
fields.details: Julie joined the investment team of Aquiline Technology Growth in 2017. Prior to joining Aquiline, Julie was an investor at Accel in Palo Alto where she focused on high-growth SaaS, mobile, and Internet businesses. Previously, she worked at Two Sigma Ventures investing in early-stage data science driven businesses. Julie began her career in venture capital at Insight Venture Partners.

fields.name: FRANCIS BOUCHARD
fields.title: GROUP HEAD OF COMMUNICATIONS AND PUBLIC AFFAIRS
fields.details: Francis Bouchard is the Group Head of Communications and Public Affairs for Zurich Insurance Group where he oversees the Group’s communications, government affairs, corporate citizenship and thought leadership initiatives. His first joined the insurance sector in 1989, and since has held a series of industry-focused lobbying, communications, sales and public affairs roles. He also served as a managing director at Hamilton Place Strategies. Francis attended Syracuse University and the George Mason University School of Law.

fields.name: PASCAL BOUVIER
fields.title: VENTURE PARTNER
fields.details: Pascal has been an active investor in the financial services industry for the past 8 years and has focused on fintech venture for the past 5. Pascal brings a breadth and depth of knowledge and experience as an executive with both large institutions and high growth SMEs, including tech startups. Pascal is currently focused on AI, digital identities and platform strategies applied to the financial services industry. Pascal is currently a Venture Partner with Santander InnoVentures.

fields.name: JAMES BOWEN
fields.title: CO-FOUNDER
fields.details: James Bowen is the co-founder of Energetic Insurance, an InsurTech startup developing innovative risk management solutions for the solar industry. James is also a Lecturer teaching product development and entrepreneurship at Olin College of Engineering. Previously, he co-founded a solar development company and was a founding team member at the Massachusetts Clean Energy Center. He is a graduate of Suffolk University Law School and The George Washington University.

fields.name: S. ERIC BOYUM
fields.title: MANAGING DIRECTOR
fields.details: Mr. Boyum serves as a Managing Director and National Leader of Aon’s Technology and Communications Industry Practice. With over 20+ years with Aon, Mr. Boyum has amassed considerable experience in executive liability program development and claim resolutions, primarily in the technology and telecommunications, life science, and retail sectors. Prior to his engagement with Aon he spent 5 years in brokerage positions in the San Francisco Bay area working with Technology clients. Mr. Boyum holds a B.S. in Business Finance with an Emphasis in Risk and Insurance from the University of Wisconsin – LaCrosse.

fields.name: ANDREW BREEN
fields.title: SVP, DIGITAL
fields.details: Andrew Breen is SVP of Digital for Argo Group, a mid-cap in the insurance and risk management space where he leads the company’s transition to a digital business. His team applies technology so Argo can become the fastest and smartest risk assessor. Andrew is formerly the VP of Product for Amex’s Enterprise Digital division and has done eight tech startups across multiple. Andrew is an adjunct professor at NYU’s Stern School of Business.

fields.name: JACOB BRODY
fields.title: FOUNDING PARTNER
fields.details: Jacob Brody is a Founding Partner at Helpful Networks, a platform consultancy and investment firm where he advise mid & large-cap clients while investing in and advising entrepreneurs building next generation platforms. Previously, Jacob was a Founding Partner at New York City based seed fund MESA Ventures and Co-Founded Benny, a Google Ventures backed freelancer tax & insurance startup. Jacob is a lifelong New Yorker, same as his wife Lauren and baby boy Bowie.

fields.name: BOB BUCKLEY
fields.title: VP CORPORATE RESEARCH
fields.details: Bob Buckley joined Church Mutual in 1988. He has held leadership roles in sales, underwriting, product management and corporate administration. Buckley graduated from LeMoyne College with a Bachelor of Science degree in Marketing, and has completed executive education programs at the MIT Sloan School of Management and the University of Virginia Darden School of Business.

fields.name: TIM CALVERT
fields.title: PRINCIPAL
fields.details: Tim is a Principal in Deloitte Consulting’s Strategy and Operations service area. He has over 22 years of experience in strategy, operations and technology consulting within the financial services industry.  Tim specializes in providing services to insurance clients, with an emphasis on individual life, annuity and group insurers. He lives in Overland Park, Kansas with his wife, Melodi and sons, Grant and Bennett.  Tim is a graduate of the University of Kansas (BS – Business Administration) and the Ross School of Business at the University of Michigan (MBA).

fields.name: MATTEO CARBONE
fields.title: FOUNDER AND DIRECTOR
fields.details: Matteo is Founder and Director of the Connected Insurance Observatory, Global InsurTech Thought Leader. He is internationally recognized as an insurance industry strategist with a specialization on innovation. Matteo is author and world-renowned authority on InsurTech - ranked among top international InsurTech Influencers - and he has spoken to audiences worldwide. Before creating the Connected Insurance Observatory, he spent 11 years in Bain & Company’s Financial Service practice. Matteo received his degree in Business Administration from Bocconi University, Milan.

fields.name: LOUIS CARBONNIER
fields.title: GLOBAL HEAD OF EULER HERMES DIGITAL AGENCY
fields.details: Louis Carbonnier joined Euler Hermes in 2014 to head the Group CEO office. In July 2015, Louis founded Euler Hermes Digital Agency (EHDA) to explore new business models and reinvent credit insurance using digital technologies. Since then, EHDA has become a reference in B2B trade, launching more than 100 PoCs and prototypes. Prior to joining EHDA, Louis worked as a Principal at Oliver Wyman. He drove strategy consulting to financial institutions focusing on digitalisation and distribution strategy internationally.

fields.name: MATT CAREY
fields.title: CO-FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: Matt is the co-founder and CEO of Blueprint Income (formerly Abaris) where he’s working to reimagine the pension in a 401(k) world using insurer-backed retirement income. Matt left the Wharton M.B.A. program to start Blueprint Income in 2014. Prior to that, he was a Policy Advisor at the US Department of Treasury, where he advised the Treasury Secretary and other senior officials on student loans and the future of retirement.

fields.name: JARED CARLSON
fields.title: DIRECTOR OF ASSURITY VENTURES
fields.details: As Director of Assurity Ventures, a certified B Corporation life and health insurer, I look to partner with or invest in early stage or expansion stage startups that have context for insurance related products. This includes insurance-specific technology entities as well as other technology startups that provide the possibility of marketing our products such as fintech and health & wellness offerings. - Stop by as I would love to help.

fields.name: BRIAN T. CASEY
fields.title: PARTNER, REGULATORY & TRANSACTIONS INSURANCE GROUP
fields.details: Brian T. Casey is a Partner in the Atlanta office of Locke Lord LLP and a member of the Corporate, Capital Markets and Health Care Practice Groups, Brian focuses on corporate, merger and acquisition, corporate and structured finance and other transactional, and regulatory matters for corporate clients in the insurance, financial services and health care industries. His clients include insurance companies, insurance holding companies, managing general agents and insurance agencies, third party and claims administrators, banks and other financial institutions, investment banks and reinsurance companies.

fields.name: JUSTIN CERILLI
fields.title: MANAGING PARTNER
fields.details: Justin Cerilli leads the firm's Financial Services Technology and Data & Analytics Practices. Within Financial Services, Justin recruits leaders for Insurance, Asset Management, Banking and Capital Markets, and Consumer Banking clients. Justin advises clients on how to recruit and retain transformational talent in Data & Analytics. He also helps boards and CEOs successfully recruit executives to FinTech companies.

fields.name: DR. NAZIM CETIN
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Dr. Nazim Cetin is the Co-CEO of Allianz X. Nazim has more than a decade of leadership experience in investing, business development and entrepreneurship. Before joining Allianz X, he held several leadership positions at media conglomerate Bertelsmann. Prior, he founded the first German magazine focusing on philosophy and economics agora 42 and was an investment banker at Maple Bank. He is a venture partner for Target Global, and an advisor for VC funds and start-ups.

fields.name: CHRIS CHEATHAM
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Chris Cheatham is the Chief Executive Officer and Co-Founder of RiskGenius. The RiskGenius platform organizes the world’s insurance policy information. Chris previously worked with the ClaimKit team to develop Privity, a document management system that has managed over $1 billion in claims. Chris holds a bachelor’s degree in political science from the University of Kansas and a juris doctorate from the University of Texas at Austin.

fields.name: MAX CHEE
fields.title: HEAD OF AQUILINE TECHNOLOGY GROWTH
fields.details: Max has over 17 years of private equity and venture capital investing experience. Prior to Aquiline, he was a Managing Partner at Millennium Technology Value Partners. Previously, he led technology growth investments for Mellon's Private Equity Group and worked at Salomon Brothers. Max is a member of the Board of Directors of Carpe Data.  He holds a Bachelor’s degree from Queen's University and an M.B.A. from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania.

fields.name: KUANG CHEN
fields.title: FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: Kuang Chen is the founder and CEO of Captricity and the recipient of MIT Technology Review's ‘35 Innovators Under 35’ award. The idea for Captricity came from Kuang’s PhD dissertation at UC Berkeley. His research focused on data-centric approaches to increase the efficiency of low-resource organizations. While doing research in Tanzania and Uganda, he experienced firsthand the importance and difficulty of transforming paper into actionable data. Captricity now provides its solution a majority of top insurance companies, as well as US government agencies, and hundreds of non-profits - to increase revenue, reduce cost, and gain insights.

fields.name: SAMANTHA CHOW
fields.title: SENIOR LIFE & ANNUITIES ANALYST
fields.details: Samantha Chow is a senior analyst with Aite Group, specializing in the life insurance and annuities industry. She brings over 15 years of experience in market research, product development, pricing strategies, competitive intelligence, project management, process improvement, and change management in the financial services industry. Prior to joining Aite Group, Ms. Chow held senior-level strategy, innovation, and research positions at New York Life Insurance Company and Aflac. She holds a bachelor’s degree in marketing and statistics and a master’s degree in international business.

fields.name: MATTHEW CHURCHILL
fields.title: HEAD OF FUTURES
fields.details: Matthew joined the UK retail division of Hiscox in 2011 and managed a large customer service initiative that included structural changes and the identification, improvement and measurement of behaviours that focussed on customer service. In 2013 he transferred to the London Market division where he was developing the e-commerce strategy for both the London and Guernsey businesses. In 2016 he moved to head up a new division within Hiscox UK, looking at innovation and disruptive trends in the insurance and fintech sector. Matthew works with start ups, VCs and entrepreneurs; finding ways to trial new ideas and innovations in a quick, cost effective way.

fields.name: BENOÎT CLAVERANNE
fields.title: GROUP CHIEF TRANSFORMATION OFFICER
fields.details: Benoît Claveranne is Group Chief Transformation Officer and a member of the AXA Management Committee. He notably oversees technology, data, distribution, operations and efficiency. He joined AXA in 2009 where he grew business and built franchises in France, in Europe and in Asia. Before joining AXA, Benoît Claveranne sat on the boards of the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank during the Global Financial crisis, after having held several positions in the French Treasury.

fields.name: MICHAEL COLES
fields.title: CHAIRMAN & CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Michael Coles is the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Cedent, a global investment firm focused on the insurance industry. He is known to have a very practical understanding of (re)insurance, alternative capital, and emerging technologies that are changing the fundamental economics of the insurance business. Previously, at Coles Advisory Partners, he advised global insurance companies with corporate finance and growth strategies. Michael is frequently sought after by government leaders, policy makers and some of the world’s largest organizations for guidance on how to navigate the increasing complexities of the global insurance markets.

fields.name: DAVID CONNOLLY
fields.title: GLOBAL INSURANCE DIGITAL LEADER
fields.details: David Connolly leads the EY Global Insurance Digital Practice. He is heading EY's focus to define a multitude of technology-enabled business offerings that help insurers quickly launch digital solutions to remain competitive. In addition, David is driving EY’s launch of a Digital Insurance Service Bureau, where EY will run and host insurance products for carriers from both a business process and IT support perspective. David is based in Silicon Valley, California.

fields.name: MICHAEL F. CONSEDINE
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Michael F. Consedine has spent his entire career in the insurance industry as an attorney, regulator, and executive. Before joining the NAIC as CEO in January 2017, he served as the Global Head of Government and Policy Affairs at Aegon, one of the world's largest financial services companies with operations in 20 countries serving over 30 million customers. Mr. Consedine served as the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania’s Insurance Commissioner from 2011 to 2015.

fields.name: CHRISTINA CRAGHOLM
fields.title: GLOBAL ENTERPRISE PARTNERSHIP LEAD - INSURANCE
fields.details: Christina Cragholm is the Global Enterprise Partnership Lead for insurance carriers at Nest Labs, Inc.Christina became a pragmatic strategist and practitioner of the Internet of Things (IoT) while at QUALCOMM, Inc.  Previously, Christina grew businesses throughout the mobile industry value chain:  hardware strategy at Samsung, carrier sales at iSkoot, embedded software partnerships at Kodiak Networks, service provider data analytics at Globalstar, and billing consulting at Accenture. Christina attended Princeton University and the MIT Sloan School of Management.

fields.name: DAX CRAIG
fields.title: PRESIDENT & CEO
fields.details: Dax Craig is the Co-Founder, President, and Chief Executive Officer of Valen Analytics – an Insurity Company. Valen is an advanced data and analytics provider for the property and casualty insurance industry. Valen works with insurers who are actively looking to improve underwriting profits by driving growth and/or lowering their loss ratio. Prior to founding Valen in 2004, Dax was founder and CEO of Xertex Technologies, a leading provider of antennas for Wi-Fi, in-building wireless, and telematics. Dax earned his MBA in finance from the University of Colorado at Boulder, and has a bachelor’s degree from the University of Tulsa.

fields.name: JAMES CRAWFORD
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: James Crawford is the founder and CEO of Orbital Insight, a geospatial big data company using deep learning analysis of satellite images to understand socio-economic trends at scale. He has worked on innovative software projects for two decades, previously leading Google Books and managing robotics at NASA's Ames Research Center.

fields.name: PAMELA PECS CYTRON
fields.title: FOUNDER, CHAIRWOMAN & CEO
fields.details: Pam Pecs Cytron has 30 years of financial services technology experience and launched Pendo Systems, Inc. in 2008. Pendo provides technology for the global capital markets industry and serves 25 percent of US G-SIFIs.  In 2015, Pendo created a machine learning platform that helps make financial institutions AI-ready by turning unstructured data into structured, AI-ready data at a machine scale. Pam’s leadership extends beyond Pendo to serving the community at local, state, and national level.

fields.name: ALEXANDRE DALYAC
fields.title: CEO & CO-FOUNDER
fields.details: Alex Dalyac is co-founder & CEO at Tractable, an artificial intelligence company that automates expert visual tasks. Tractable’s AI technology is the leader in auto damage appraisal; its products are used globally by leading insurers. Prior to cofounding Tractable, Alex was a hedge fund quant, and a business developer at “startup unicorn” Lazada. Alex holds a degree in econometrics from the London School of Economics, and a master’s in computer science from Imperial College London, where he is a recipient of the Philips Prize in Computer Science for 2014.

fields.name: MARCUS DANIELS
fields.title: FOUNDING PARTNER & CEO
fields.details: Marcus Daniels is a digital product entrepreneur, pre-seed venture capitalist and corporate accelerator expert that helps co-create new ventures with the Global 2000. A Founding Partner of Highline BETA which is a Startup Co-Creation company launching new ventures with corporations in FinTech, InsurTech and Digital Health. Co-Founder of HIGHLINE, a pre-seed vc with 32 active startup investments and 14 exits. Prior to HIGHLINE Marcus was the Managing Director of Extreme Startups and COO at TrendHunter.com.

fields.name: TIM DANKER
fields.title: PRESIDENT, LIFE INSURANCE
fields.details: Tim is the President of SelectQuote Insurance Services, America’s largest independent term life insurance agency focused on direct-to- consumer insurance distribution. Previously Tim founded and led SelectQuote Auto & Home, one of the country’s largest DTC property and casualty brokerages. In 2007 Tim co-founded and was the Chief Executive Officer of Spring Venture Group, a high-growth national tech-enabled insurance platform in the senior health, auto/home and life insurance verticals. Tim has a Business Degree from the University of Missouri and his MBA from the University of Kansas.

fields.name: MORAN DAVID
fields.title: GENERAL MANAGER OF NORTH AMERICA
fields.details: Moran David is Mobileye’s General Manager of North America. Moran has spent the last 18 years as an entrepreneur and a consultant, specializing in travel, retail, consumer products, e-commerce and business strategies. Moran has vast experience working with retailers, B2B and service companies on strategy, finance, growth channels, innovation and infrastructure planning. He was also the founder of Boom Sushi in NY, the CEO of Sabon USA, and the founder of Nature Adventure in Chile.

fields.name: MARIEL DEVESA
fields.title: HEAD OF CORPORATE DEVELOPMENT
fields.details: Mariel Devesa is the Head of Corporate Development and Innovation at Farmers Insurance, a Fortune 500 company and one of the nation’s leading property and casualty insurers.  She is responsible for the development of relationships and programs addressing changes in the new economy to acquire and retain customers and improve existing capabilities.  Devesa has directly developed and lead programs generating in excess of $300M in annual revenue. Farmers was the 1st insurer to incorporate phone distraction in a telematics offering in 2017 and the 1st mainstream carrier to launch coverage’s for rideshare drivers in 2015; which is now live in 29 states.

fields.name: TED DEVINE
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Ted Devine is the CEO of Insureon, the nation’s leading online small-business insurance agency. Prior to joining Insureon, Devine held several senior executive leadership positions at Aon Corporation, including President of Aon Risk Services, which boasts more than $5 billion in revenue and 28,000 employees worldwide, and CEO of Aon Re. Before joining Aon, Devine spent 12 years as Director of McKinsey & Company, helping improve the performance of Fortune 500 companies.

fields.name: BRENDAN DICKINSON
fields.title: PARTNER
fields.details: Brendan invests in startups that are changing the world with code in the fintech, e-commerce and digital media sectors. He built Canaan’s investment thesis in insurance and is passionate about companies that re-imagine how insurance products are purchased and sold. Previously, Brendan was a senior quantitative analyst at Lehman Brothers and Barclays Capital. He holds an M.B.A. with distinction from NYU Stern School of Business, an M.S. in Computer Science from Brown University, and a B.A. in Political Science from Bowdoin College.

fields.name: DREW DOLESKI
fields.title: PRODUCT MANAGER – IOT, CONNECTED HOME
fields.details: Drew Doleski is responsible for smart home product development at Verisk Insurance Solutions, a market leader of advanced data and analytics services to insurance, healthcare, financial services, supply chain, and energy markets. Drew comes from a broad background at the intersection of insurance and technology. His past work experience includes Samsung SmartThings, Esurance, Allstate, and Bang & Olufsen, where he has held roles in marketing, operations, and product development. He is an alumnus of Loyola University Chicago's Quinlan School of Business.

fields.name: PAULA DOWNEY
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Paula Downey is president and chief executive officer of CSAA Insurance Group, a AAA Insurer. She joined CSAA Insurance Group and its AAA club affiliate, AAA Northern California, Nevada &  Utah, as the chief financial officer in 2000. Ms. Downey was promoted to chief operations officer in 2003, president in 2005 and president and CEO in 2010. Previously, Ms. Downey had a career with the Auto Club Group in Dearborn, Michigan

fields.name: MAX DRUCKER
fields.title: CEO & PRESIDENT
fields.details: As co-founder and CEO, Max Drucker leads development and execution at Carpe Data, which provides next generation predictive scoring and data products to P&C and life insurance companies. Carpe Data is the latest in a series of innovative, insurance-focused technology companies that Max has co-founded, which include Social Intelligence, Steel Card, and eCoverage. Max has also been recognized by Insurance & Technology Magazine as one of its Top 10 Innovators of the Decade.

fields.name: SASTRY DURVASULA
fields.title: CHIEF DIGITAL OFFICER AND CHIEF DATA & ANALYTICS OFFICER
fields.details: Sastry Durvasula is Marsh’s Chief Digital Officer and Chief Data & Analytics Officer. With deep experience in Big Data, Blockchain and Digital platforms, Sastry leads Marsh’s overall strategy and delivery for all things digital and data. Previously, he was Enterprise Head of Data & Digital Tech at American Express, where he launched the company’s Big Data ecosystem and innovative B2C/B2B digital experiences. Sastry plays an active role in leading industry consortia and is credited with several patents.

fields.name: BRUCE EATROFF
fields.title: FOUNDING PARTNER
fields.details: Bruce Eatroff is the Founding Partner of Halyard Capital, a lower middle market private equity firm with over $600 million of assets under management.  Founded in 2000, Halyard focuses on investments in sectors such as Financial Services Technology, IT & Tech-Enabled Services, Information Services and Digital Marketing.  Prior to founding Halyard, Bruce was an investment banker at Goldman Sachs, UBS and CIBC.  Mr. Eatroff has an MBA from Wharton and a B.A. from Lafayette College.

fields.name: ADAM ERLEBACHER
fields.title: CO-FOUNDER AND CEO
fields.details: Fabric Co-Founder & CEO Adam Erlebacher was formerly COO at Simple where he led Simple’s growth from pre-launch to hundreds of thousands of customers (acquired by BBVA). Prior to Simple, he co-founded PlaceVine, an online advertising marketplace (acquired 2011), and led business development at natural language startup Colloquis (acquired by Microsoft). Earlier, Adam specialized in technology, media, & telecom transactions at JPMorgan. He received his B.A. from Tufts University and an M.B.A. from The Wharton School.

fields.name: MADS FAURHOLT-JORGENSEN
fields.title: FOUNDER AND CHAIRMAN
fields.details: Mads is a Serial Entrepreneur, and the Founder and Managing Partner of Nova Founders Capital. Within Financial Services, Mads has founded companies such as CompareGlobalGroup, CompareAsiaGroup, CompareEuropeGroup, Private Equity Insights, and ComparaGuru.com, backed by investors including Goldman Sachs, QED, Peter Thiel, and The World Bank. Mads holds the record for the fastest completed bachelor in Denmark, where he is from, and received his MBA from MIT, where he graduated as one of the youngest ever.

fields.name: JAMES M. FISCHER
fields.title: PARTNER
fields.details: James Fischer is a partner and co-vice chair of the firm’s Corporate and Securities Practice Group and a member of the Corporate Venture team. Jim represents both public and private clients in various industries including medical, chemical, pharmaceutical and nutraceutical, and general manufacturing. Jim focuses his practices on mergers and acquisitions, divestitures, entrepreneurial matters, venture capital financings, secured and unsecured financing/lending transactions, corporate restructurings and general corporate matters. Jim also focuses his practice on advising both individual and institutional clients in a variety of matters.

fields.name: COLIN FITT
fields.title: SVP, CORPORATE DEVELOPMENT
fields.details: Colin Fitt is the Senior VP of Corporate Development at Maiden Re. Maiden Re is a publicly traded Bermudian reinsurance company that focuses on low volatility reinsurance for small and mid sized regional and specialty insurance companies. Colin’s reinsurance carrier began as a reinsurance broker developing specialties in catastrophe modeling and  structured reinsurance. He later went on to work for the private equity arm of GE pursuing strategic investments. Prior to joining Maiden he spent 13 years as an insurance investment banker focusing on mergers and acquisition and capital raising.

fields.name: JENNIFER FITZGERALD
fields.title: CEO & CO-FOUNDER
fields.details: Jennifer Fitzgerald is the CEO and Co-Founder of PolicyGenius, an independent digital insurance company for consumers. Previously, she was a junior partner at McKinsey & Company, where she advised Fortune 100 financial services companies on marketing and strategy. Jennifer regularly shares her insights on personal finance and insurance tech and serves as an expert on the insurance industry and entrepreneurial path. She is a graduate of Columbia Law School and Florida State University.

fields.name: MIKE FITZGERALD
fields.title: SENIOR ANALYST
fields.details: Mike brings extensive industry experience to the analyst role. Prior to Celent, he was VP of Enterprise Underwriting Solutions at Zurich North America. He held a number of executive positions at RSA, including a Regional Operations role. Mike's research focuses on innovation, emerging technologies, business process and operations, and distribution management. Mike has a BA in economics from Davidson College and a MBA from Duke University. He is a Chartered Property Casualty Underwriter (CPCU) and a certified Project Management Professional (PMP).

fields.name: GUY FRAKER
fields.title: CHIEF INNOVATION OFFICER
fields.details: Guy has 30 years within the insurance industry and been on the leading edge of building innovation systems for the past 10 years spanning primary carriers, reinsurers, and related sectors. As Chief Innovation Officer, Guy leads ITL’s Innovator’s Studio, helping insurance providers leverage consistent innovation for long term leadership, growth, stability. Guy is also one of the world’s leading authorities on the risks and opportunities associated with autonomous vehicles.

fields.name: KENNETH FRASER
fields.title: EVP AND CHIEF STRATEGIC AND DEV OFFICER
fields.details: Ken Fraser joined Crawford & Co. in June 2015 as the chief strategic and development officer and partners with business segment leaders and corporate executives to conceive and execute strategic, long-term financial plans for Crawford. His responsibilities include developing competitive analysis of the competitive landscape to contribute to decisions about new markets, products and pricing.  Prior to coming to Crawford, he held executive roles with Wells Fargo Insurance and Marsh & McLennan.

fields.name: BRIAN GAAB
fields.title: STRATEGY & INNOVATION
fields.details: Brian Gaab is a strategy and innovation leader for CSAA Insurance Group, a AAA insurer.  The company has been serving AAA members for over 100 years offering automobile, homeowners, and other personal lines of insurance. Brian joined the company in 2013 in corporate strategy, and in 2015 began with the new Strategy & Innovation function for CSAA IG where he focuses on implementing new technologies inside the company to make insurance simple, proactive, and personal.

fields.name: ADAM GABRAULT
fields.title: VP & GLOBAL HEAD - CONNECTED EXPERIENCE
fields.details: Adam Gabrault, VP & Global Head of Connected Experience is a 10+ IT services veteran with a proven track record delivering enterprise-grade digital solutions and leading professional services organizations in the US, Europe and APAC.  Adam has global responsibility for Virtusa’s mobile + IOT practice. He works with the team to ensure client success through all phases from defining strategy, designing, building and launching connected experiences across the Banking & Financial Services, Healthcare, Insurance, Media & Diversified industries.  Prior to joining Virtusa, Adam was Director, Delivery & Northeast PMO for Mobiquity and held leadership positions with APN Outdoor, Experian Data Quality, and Micros-Retail.

fields.name: BRENDAN GALLAGHER
fields.title: AREA PRESIDENT - MANHATTAN
fields.details: In addition to helping lead the innovation strategy for broker Arthur J. Gallagher & Co., Brendan Gallagher serves as Area President - Manhattan. Prior to that, he was the head of Business Development for Gallagher’s Chicagoland Property & Casualty operations, where he also led the company’s Senior Care Practice across the United States.

fields.name: MALIKA GANDHI
fields.title: PRINCIPAL
fields.details: Malika Gandhi is a Principal in Deloitte Consulting’s Insurance Strategy practice, with more than 15 years of experience across the financial services industry, spanning insurance, retirement services, retail banking, and capital markets. Over the last 3+ years, she led the development and launch of D-rive, Deloitte’s end-to- end telematics platform for the auto insurance sector. Malika holds a BA in Economics from The Johns Hopkins University and an MBA from Duke University’s Fuqua School of Business.

fields.name: PRASHANTH GANGU
fields.title: PARTNER
fields.details: Prashanth Gangu is a Partner at Oliver Wyman in the Insurance practice. He works on business strategy, new venture setup, organizational design and large-scale transformation across the insurance value chain for insurers, and on transaction advisory for private equity investors. Prashanth is involved with the World Economic Forum and was a keynote speaker at ITC2016.

fields.name: GAURAV D. GARG
fields.title: CEO, PERSONAL INSURANCE
fields.details: Gaurav D. Garg is the Chief Executive Officer of Personal Insurance, responsible for Private Client Group, Personal Accident and Supplemental Health, Personal Auto and Property, Travel Guard and Assistance Services, Extended Warranty and Service Programs. Prior to joining AIG, Gaurav was a Senior Partner and President at Mercer and member of the Executive Committee. He was also with AIG from 2000 to 2012, holding various management and leadership positions across AIG’s Personal Line insurance business.

fields.name: RUCHIT GARG
fields.title: FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: Ruchit is Founder & CEO of Harvesting, a company focused on enabling financial inclusion for farmers in emerging world. Prior to Harvesting, Ruchit was Founder & CEO of 9Slides, an online learning company for growing businesses, which was acquired by Limeade in 2015. Prior to that Ruchit worked for Microsoft at Redmond HQ and Hyderabad for several years and contributed to many key projects such as XBOX Live, Windows 7, MSN Games etc. Ruchit is also chairman of Shobhit University Alumni Network and mentor/advisor to several startups in India and USA.

fields.name: DENISE GARTH
fields.title: SENIOR VICE PRESIDENT – STRATEGIC MARKETING, INDUSTRY RELATIONS AND INNOVATION
fields.details: Denise Garth, a Top 50 InsurTech Influencer, is Senior Vice President Strategic Marketing responsible for leading marketing, industry relations and innovation in support of Majesco’s client centric strategy, working closely with Majesco customers, partners and the industry. Prior to joining Majesco, Denise held business and technology senior executive roles with leading insurance companies. Denise is a Cum Laude graduate, with a BS in Math and Computer Science from Central College in Iowa.

fields.name: JAY GAUTHIER
fields.title: CMO, PERSONAL INSURANCE
fields.details: Jay Gauthier has been a leader in driving digital marketing innovation, strategy, and execution for some of world’s leading direct-to- consumer technology and financial services brands. Jay currently serves as the CMO of Personal Insurance for Travelers, overseeing the company’s marketing functions that support its Direct-to- Consumer and Retail Marketing channels in Personal Insurance. Prior to his assignment at Travelers Insurance, Jay has also held direct-to- consumer digital and direct marketing roles at Microsoft, IBM Direct, Compaq Direct, and Lotus Development Corp. Jay holds a B.A.of English from the Massachusetts College of Liberal Arts.

fields.name: RYAN GILBERT
fields.title: GENERAL PARTNER
fields.details: Ryan brings 20 years of global fintech experience to Propel Venture Partners. Ryan is executive chairman of SmartBizLoans, a SMB lending marketplace he co-founded as an EIR at Venrock; the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation’s director of bKash, Bangladesh’s leading remittance network; and a director of River City Bank in Sacramento. He was co-founder/CEO of real estate payments company PropertyBridge (acquired by MoneyGram International), an early investor in Eventbrite, and a founding advisor to Square.

fields.name: JEFF GOLDBERG
fields.title: SVP, RESEARCH & CONSULTING
fields.details: Jeff Goldberg, SVP, Research and Consulting at Novarica, is an expert in areas including data analytics, digital strategy, SaaS/cloud computing, and software engineering. Previous roles include senior analyst at Celent; VP, Internet Technology for Marsh Inc.; Director, Web Technology for Harleysville Insurance; independent software consultant; and Microsoft researcher. He has a BSE in computer science from Princeton University and an MFA from the New School in New York.

fields.name: GUY GOLDSTEIN
fields.title: FOUNDER AND CEO
fields.details: Guy Goldstein, Founder and CEO of Next Insurance, is focused on transforming small business insurance, making it simple, fast, and transparent.  Guy brings over 20 years of experience in technology, product development, management, and strategy.  Prior to Next Insurance, Guy was the Founder & CEO of Check, a mobile payment company, which was sold to Intuit for $360M. Guy served in the Israeli Air Force as a major and fighter pilot.

fields.name: MICHAEL GRAHAM
fields.title: CEO AND CO-FOUNDER
fields.details: Based in Sydney, Australia, Michael Graham is a co-founder of Mercurien Insurance Pty Ltd and Principal of Fleetrisk. With a background in brand and product innovation Mr Graham is now focussing his efforts on innovation in insurance at the intersection of technology, data analytics and emerging business models. Mercurien has recently been accepted into the Singapore based KPMG Digital Village to develop MVP for on-demand car insurance.

fields.name: PETER GROSS
fields.title: DIRECTOR OF MICROENSURE LABS
fields.details: Peter heads the innovation incubator at MicroEnsure, the world’s leading microinsurance company. After joining the company in Ghana in 2010, he built the MicroEnsure Africa mobile insurance model, which has since reached more than 50 million registered customers in 12 countries. 85% of MicroEnsure’s customers were previously uninsured. Now based in the US, Peter directs innovation teams as a separate vertical within MicroEnsure’s footprint. He holds degrees from Oxford University, Emory University, and Davidson College.

fields.name: TSHIDI HAGAN
fields.title: ADVISOR IN RESIDENCE
fields.details: Tshidi Hagan currently serves as an Advisor in Residence at Startupbootcamp InsurTech, a leading global insurance technology accelerator programme (“the Programme”). She’s responsible for ensuring the Programme’s strategy evolves to align with the ongoing and changing needs of the Programme’s key stakeholders: primarily this includes the Programme’s corporate sponsors, investors, and startups. Previously Tshidi was an investment professional working for Old Mutual Emerging Market’s (“OMEM’s”) corporate venture fund, known internally as the Strategic Investment Fund. She holds a Bachelor in Business Science from the University of Cape Town and a Masters Level Diploma in Taxation from the University of the Witwatersrand.

fields.name: JAMIE HALE
fields.title: CO-FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: Jamie is Ladder’s CEO and Co-Founder. He believes life insurance is a fundamentally great product for families and communities and so built Ladder to be the instant, simple, and smart way to insure your life. Prior to co-founding Ladder, Jamie was Partner at Aldenwood Capital and at Oak Hill Investment Management, a premier family office with over $12 billion in assets. He also worked at NextCard, pioneering instant credit and the first ‘internet enabled’ Visa card. Jamie is a graduate of Bowdoin College and Harvard Business School.

fields.name: GABRIEL HALIMI
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Gabriel Halimi is the CEO and Co-Founder of Flo, a first of its kind water control and monitoring system that proactively detects microleaks and other vulnerabilities anywhere in a home water system, protecting the home, promoting maintenance and empowering conservation. Prior to co-founding Flo, he was an equity partner of a law firm, and then later joined the Umami Burger restaurants as VP of Corporate Operations.  He lives in LA with his wife and twins.

fields.name: GARY HALLGREN
fields.title: PRESIDENT
fields.details: Gary Hallgren is president at Arity, a technology company founded by The Allstate Corporation that provides a platform of data and insight solutions for customers across the globe. In this role he leads the development and implementation of Arity’s strategy and operations. Hallgren and his team at Arity are currently focused on bringing new products and services to market that enhance the consumer driving experience and help increase safety on the road.

fields.name: ADAM HAMM
fields.title: MANAGING DIRECTOR
fields.details: Adam Hamm is a Managing Director with Protiviti focused on serving financial services clients concerning risk, compliance, and cybersecurity matters. He has deep knowledge of financial services regulation with hands-on experience in all insurance supervision and policy related matters. Adam served as a former President of the National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC), Chairman of the NAIC’s Cybersecurity Task Force, Principal on the United States Financial Stability Oversight Council and North Dakota’s elected insurance commissioner.

fields.name: DAVE HANLEY
fields.title: CEO AND CO-FOUNDER
fields.details: Dave Hanley – an accomplished digital entrepreneur and social advocate – is CEO of Tomorrow, which helps families make long-term financial and legal decisions together for the first time, in an easy-to- use app. Previously, Dave founded Banyan Branch, a leading social media agency, acquired by Deloitte. Prior to that, Dave was VP of Marketing at Shelfari, a social network for readers, acquired by Amazon. Earlier in his career, Dave worked with NGOs and banks implementing and assessing microcredit programs, including time as a Fulbright scholar. Dave holds an MBA from Stanford and Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees from BYU.

fields.name: DANIEL HATKOFF
fields.title: FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: Daniel is the founder of Pitzi, the leading provider of protection plans for cellphones in Brazil. Pitzi is backed by leading investors including Thrive Capital, Kaszek Ventures, DCM and QED Investors. Daniel is also an advisor to venture fund Flybridge Capital Partners, where he supports their investment activity in Latin America. Prior to Pitzi, Daniel served as a private equity analyst with Warburg Pincus' financial institutions team in New York City.  He holds a Bachelor of Arts from Oberlin College.

fields.name: DR. STEFAN HECK
fields.title: CEO & FOUNDER
fields.details: Dr. Stefan Heck is CEO/Founder of Nauto, whose AI-powered connected auto camera network is making driver safer and smarter today and informing future autonomous vehicle development. Prior, he was professor/research fellow at Stanford University. He also led McKinsey’s Cleantech and Sustainability practice worldwide. He is a board director, angel investor and author of Resource Revolution. Stefan has a Ph.D. in Cognitive Science from UCSD and a B.S. with honors in Symbolic Systems from Stanford University.

fields.name: BRIAN HEMESATH
fields.title: MANAGING DIRECTOR
fields.details: Brian Hemesath is the Managing Director of the Global Insurance Accelerator. The GIA is a 100-day program designed to help early-stage InsurTech companies grow. He is responsible for the overall success of the program and ongoing support of the portfolio companies. He has built a career around technology startups, having been a founder and co-founder of several businesses.

fields.name: BETH HERMAN
fields.title: DIRECTOR IT
fields.details: Beth is an experienced technology leader, spending the last 10 years in the financial services industry.  In her current role with Principal, she heads a technology department that supports capabilities for product distribution.  In addition, Beth partners closely with the Global Insurance Accelerator to connect business leaders at Principal with InsureTech start-ups, to explore innovative solutions to customer needs.

fields.name: SUSAN HOLLIDAY
fields.title: PRINCIPAL INSURANCE SPECIALIST
fields.details: Susan joined IFC in April 2016 as an insurance specialist in FIG. She focuses particularly on developing new investment business and on health insurance and new technologies and in promoting our work insurance for women. Prior to IFC, Susan worked at Swiss Re. Susan is a British national. She graduated from Magdalen College, Oxford with a degree in modern history. In 2014, Susan completed the Advanced Management Program at Harvard Business School.

fields.name: CARIBOU HONIG
fields.title: CHAIRMAN
fields.details: Caribou Honig is cofounder of QED Investors, a boutique venture capital firm focused on financial services. His investments span an array of marketing, payments, and insurance technology companies particularly where B2C customer acquisition drives the business. He serves on the Darden Corporate Advisory Board and is Chairman & Cofounder of the InsureTech Connect conference. He and his wife have two children and two occasionally annoying dogs.

fields.name: RICK HU, MD
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Dr. Hu has been a practicing Spinal surgeon for more than 25 years and has held leadership roles in research, teaching and healthcare administration. Dr. Hu is the Founder and CEO of Vivametrica Ltd., a provider of predictive risk analysis to the insurance industry and group wellness program providers. Vivametrica redefines how individuals and organizations measure health risk by combining easy to use, science based analysis tools with personalized data from IoT sensors.

fields.name: DUSTIN HUBBARD
fields.title: CHIEF DIGITAL OFFICER
fields.details: Mr. Hubbard has 24 years’ experience in the technology sector. After spending 15 years at Microsoft running various software development departments, he became a serial entrepreneur. In 2013, Mr. Hubbard became CTO of a start-up insurance company, AssureStart, that focused on selling small business insurance online. In 2015, American Family Insurance acquired AssureStart and merged it with their operating company, Homesite Insurance. Mr. Hubbard currently serves as Chief Digital Officer at Homesite.

fields.name: OLEG ILICHEV
fields.title: HEAD OF INVESTMENTS
fields.details: Oleg is Argo Digital’s Head of Investments, overseeing the VC fund allocated from Argo Group’s $4B investment portfolio. Previously, he held a variety of positions at Argo Group, including SVP & CFO of Argo’s US Operations. Prior to Argo, Oleg focused on financial institutions within Bear Stearns Merchant Banking, Bear’s private equity fund, and within Bear Stearns’ investment banking division. Oleg holds an MBA from MIT and a BA from Columbia University.

fields.name: ROMAN ITSKOVICH
fields.title: CO-FOUNDER
fields.details: Roman is the co-founder of CyberJack, a venture backed cyber insurance startup. Previously, he built an online lending business at Ebury, a Greylock backed Fintech firm, was on the investment team of Bain Capital, and was a consultant with Mckinsey&Co. Roman holds an MBA from Harvard Business School.

fields.name: JONATHAN KALMAN
fields.title: GENERAL PARTNER
fields.details: Jonathan has 18 years of FinTech and InsurTech investing experience, as CEO and Managing Partner of Jaguar Capital Partners, and prior to that as CEO and Managing Partner of Katalyst, an Internet Accelerator. Jonathan has had many notable exits, including the sale of Blockchain provider INVeSHARE to Broadridge Financial Group (NYSE: BR), Enerwise acquired by ComVerge, ERisk acquired by SunGard and several IPO’s including Breakaway Solutions (NASDAQ: BWAY), China Cablecom Ltd. (NASDAQ: CABL) and Internet Capital Group (NASDAQ: ICGE), now Actua (NASDAQ: ACTA).

fields.name: FRANK KASIMOV
fields.title: CO-FOUNDER
fields.details: Frank Kasimov is a co-founder of an insurance tech startup InsuranceRevenue.com, a marketplace for publishers to sell leads, calls and clicks for auto, home, life, and business insurance. Insurance Revenue uses big data and machine learning to improve its platform to help publishers get top payouts and buyers find targeted quality prospects.

fields.name: REZA KHORSHIDI
fields.title: CHIEF SCIENTIST, GLOBAL
fields.details: Reza is currently the Chief Scientist at AIG (leading the company's AI research and InsurTech innovations, globally), as well as one of the co-leads of Deep Medicine program at the University of Oxford's Martin School (focused on healthcare innovation, and the use of AI in digital health ecosystems). He obtained his DPhil (i.e., PhD) in computational neuroscience and machine learning from the University of Oxford in 2010, and since then has been leading teams, research initiatives, and disruptive innovation projects in both academia and industry.

fields.name: PEGGY KLINGEL
fields.title: CLAIMS INNOVATION STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS, SENIOR MANAGER
fields.details: Ms. Klingel is a transformational business leader with a record of building market value working with turnaround and startup organizations in a variety of industries. Peggy is currently supporting Allstate’s Claims Innovation team developing strategic partnerships and startup engagement strategy. Peggy is a C.P.A., holds an M.B.A. from Northern Illinois University as well as a Bachelor’s of Accountancy from Marquette University. Peggy also holds Chartered Property and Casualty Underwriter (CPCU) and Associate in Reinsurance (ARe) designations.

fields.name: ED KLINGER
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Ed is the CEO of Flock, a London-based insurtech startup that uses Big-Data to quantify risks in real time and insure drone flights. Flock has partnered with a world-leading insurance company to launch their first product in the UK: Pay-as-you-fly drone insurance, sold through a smartphone app. Ed recently graduated from Cambridge University Technology Policy (MPhil), where he published various papers on autonomous vehicles, government policy for artificial intelligence, and the future of the drone industry.

fields.name: JOSH KOPLEWICZ
fields.title: MANAGING PARTNER
fields.details: Josh Koplewicz is the founder of Thayer Street Partners, a boutique private investment firm based in New York City. Thayer Street provides flexible, private growth capital solutions to middle market business and financial services companies that are often technology-enabled and or leverage the internet, data analytics or software to scale their businesses. Prior to Thayer Street, Josh was an investor at Goldman Sachs & Co’s Special Situation Group where he invested across the capital structure in financial services and business services assets and companies.

fields.name: JON-MIKE KOWALL
fields.title: ASSISTANT VP OF PROPERTY & CASUALTY INNOVATION
fields.details: Jon-Mike Kowall heads up a strategic team at USAA focused on taking innovation to the next level for the USAA Insurance Company. With 20 years of financial industry experience ranging from actuarial, underwriting, product development, finance, and emerging analytics, Jon-Michael is currently the Assistant VP of Property Insurance Product Development & Innovation. This team is finding new and better ways to create value for the 12 million members of USAA by leveraging new and emerging technologies, creating strategic partnerships, and thinking outside the box.

fields.name: RYAN KOTTENSTETTE
fields.title: CEO AND CO-FOUNDER
fields.details: Ryan Kottenstette is the CEO and co-founder of Cape Analytics, which leverages geospatial imagery and artificial intelligence to create a living database of the most accurate and up-to-date property data for (re)insurers and other property stakeholders. Prior to cofounding Cape Analytics, Ryan was an investor at Khosla Ventures, a leading Silicon Valley venture capital firm where he invested in and incubated companies applying computer vision and artificial intelligence in industries ranging from shipping logistics, to agriculture, to healthcare.

fields.name: REICHEN KUHL
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Reichen Kuhl, a military veteran (Air Force Captain) is a graduate of the U.S. Air Force Academy, a flight instructor, published author, and holds a Juris Doctorate from Loyola Law School. Reichen, winner of Season 4 of CBS’ “The Amazing Race," is an attorney and the CEO of LeaseLock, the first nationwide Rent Payment Insurance company.

fields.name: RON KUNITZKY
fields.title: CHIEF PARTNERSHIP OFFICER
fields.details: Ron Kunitzky is the Chief Partnership Officer at Highline BETA, a company that helps forward-thinking enterprises innovate faster and co-create new ventures in the areas of InsurTech, Fintech, Digital Health and CPG. Formerly, Ron was the President of Geyser Marketing Group; a Digital Co-Marketing Agency whose customers include leading technology and media companies like Google and Rogers Communications. He is the author of “Partnership Marketing” (Wiley) and has led workshops for several Fortune 1000 companies.

fields.name: IVY KUSINGA
fields.title: SVP, CHIEF CULTURE OFFICER
fields.details: Ivy was appointed to Senior Vice President and Chief Culture Officer following ACE Limited’s acquisition of Chubb; a transaction that created a global leader in property and casualty insurance. Ivy is responsible for ensuring the clarity and consistency of Chubb’s culture of craftsmanship, characterized by its commitment to superior underwriting, execution and service. Chubb also strives to be a diverse and inclusive meritocracy positioned to continually attract and retain the best talent.

fields.name: VINCENZO LA RUFFA
fields.title: PARTNER AND HEAD OF THE FINANCIAL TECHNOLOGY AND SERVICES GROUP
fields.details: Vincenzo is a Partner and Head of the Financial Technology and Services Group at Aquiline Capital Partners, a private equity firm focused on investing in financial services and technology. Prior to joining Aquiline in 2014, he was Managing Director of Susquehanna Growth Equity, a private equity group he co-founded that focuses on financial technology and software. Vincenzo is a Trustee of the National Catholic Bioethics Center, the Collegium Institute at the University of Pennsylvania, the Foundation for Excellence in Higher Education, and Christendom College. He earned a B.A. in Classics and a B.S. in Economics from the University of Pennsylvania.

fields.name: BRIAN LANZRATH
fields.title: HEAD OF ANALYTICS
fields.details: Brian Lanzrath is the Director of Analytics at ExamOne, Inc. His main areas of professional focus include predictive modeling for mortality and fraud, as well as the development of analytics-driven quality metrics for producers, paramedical examiners, and underwriters. His work has been published in multiple industry journals, including On the Risk and the Journal of Insurance Medicine, and he is a regular speaker on applications for big data and analytics in the life insurance industry.

fields.name: TONY LAUDATO
fields.title: VP, PARTNERSHIP SOLUTIONS
fields.details: Tony joined the Hannover Re Group in July 2012 and is currently leading the Partnership Solutions group that supports insurance carriers’ products, web, mobile and digital strategies that are focused on the demands of today’s consumers and reaching new markets. With almost 25 years in the insurance industry, Tony has a varied background in product development, pricing, risk management, distribution, consulting and strategic planning.

fields.name: HEIDI LAWSON
fields.title: PARTNER
fields.details: Heidi is a sought-after insurance lawyer for her uncommon business perspective as an industry insider and reputation as a trusted advisor. She leads insurtech innovators and capital providers through product innovation and helps identify additional ways to maximize profit. Heidi advises VC firms business plan assessment in the context of regulatory compliance. She also assists entrepreneurs with shaping new technology within the global insurance regulatory framework and has experience with app-based and data-driven solutions.

fields.name: LUKE LEDBETTER
fields.title: EVP & CHIEF UNDERWRITING OFFICER, PROGRAM SERVICES
fields.details: Luke Ledbetter joined State National Companies in 2010 and serves as Executive Vice President and Chief Underwriting Officer of Program Services. Luke’s responsibilities include expanding program services business and strengthening relationships with existing partners. Additionally, he is responsible for the program and credit underwriting and reinsurance functions. Luke obtained law degrees from The University of Texas School of Law and Cambridge University. Prior to joining State National, Luke practiced law with Baker Botts LLP.

fields.name: MATTHEW LEONARD
fields.title: PARTNER
fields.details: Matt Leonard is a Partner at Oliver Wyman where he advises a globally operating client base within the insurance ecosystem. He leads the firm’s insurtech platform and was a keynote speaker at ITC2016.

fields.name: ANDREW LERNER
fields.title: MANAGING PARTNER
fields.details: Andrew S. Lerner is Managing Partner of IA Capital Group, a fintech/insurtech-focused venture capital firm. Mr. Lerner is a director of Homeowners of America, Hedgeco Networks, Ceannate, Credibility Capital, SmartAsset, Wellthie, Crown Global, and Marqeta. Mr. Lerner holds a B.S.E. in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science from Princeton University and an M.B.A. in Finance from The Wharton School, University of Pennsylvania.

fields.name: SPIKE LIPKIN
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Spike is the CEO of Abe, a modern commercial insurance brokerage that leverages technology to better serve companies and make brokers more efficient. Previously he was on the early team at Opendoor.com and was an investor at Blackstone, where he helped start Invitation Homes. He received his MBA from Stanford.

fields.name: CHRISTOPHER LONGO
fields.title: CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER
fields.details: Christopher M. Longo, Executive Vice President, Chief Operating Officer, joined the Company in 2001 and has been Chief Operating Officer since 2016. Mr. Longo served as Chief Information Officer from 2006 – 2017. Prior to joining the Company, Mr. Longo served in a number of functions with Credit General Insurance Company including as a commercial lines underwriter, actuarial analyst and regulatory compliance officer.

fields.name: DAVID D. LUCE
fields.title: PARTNER
