fields.details: David Luce has over 18 years of experience as an attorney and investment banker advising insurance companies, investment banks, and start-ups on insurance and fintech matters, M&A, securities offerings, structured finance, and venture capital and emerging growth financings and equity raises.  He also helps clients with regulatory compliance and investigations and complex consumer litigation.

fields.name: DAVID LYMAN
fields.title: CO-FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: David is Co-Founder and CEO of Betterview, the leading platform for drone-based property inspections. Betterview is quickly becoming the essential platform for every transaction around buildings and properties for decision-makers who want to reduce risk, cost, and waste in an increasingly competitive environment. Prior to Betterview, David started a company that built social media software for small businesses which he sold to Constant Contact and built enterprise workflow and data analysis software while at Accenture.

fields.name: ADAM LYONS
fields.title: FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: Adam Lyons is CEO at The Zebra, which he founded in 2012 and has grown into the nation’s most visited car insurance comparison marketplace. Adam previously worked at Lloyd’s of London and as an underwriter at All Risks LTD. He holds a BBA with a specialization in Risk Management & Insurance from Temple University’s Fox School of Business. In 2017 Adam was named to Forbes’ 30 Under 30 List and spoke alongside Mark Cuban at South By Southwest.

fields.name: BETH MAERZ
fields.title: VP INNOVATION
fields.details: Beth Maerz is the VP Innovation and Customer Experience at Travelers. She joined the company in 2005 in Product Management, moving on to positions of greater responsibility. Prior to joining Travelers in 2005, Beth held leadership positions with a variety of marketing and management consulting firms. Beth earned her undergraduate degree in Economics from the University of Connecticut and a Master’s degree in Business Administration and Economics from Boston University.

fields.name: ALEX MAFFEO
fields.title: FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: Alex is Founder and CEO of Boost Insurance. Alex recently founded Boost while Principal at IA Capital Group – a leading fintech and insurtech-focused VC firm in New York – where he gained almost a decade of experience investing in early stage startups. Alex helped spearhead insurtech investment activity at IA and completed multiple portfolio company investments in the space including Sure, Snapsheet, Wellthie, SmartAsset, and Hamilton Insurance Group.

fields.name: JASJIT MAGGU
fields.title: CO-FOUNDER
fields.details: Jas is the Chief Operating Officer and co-founder of Galaxy.AI. She has been part of the boards of early stage companies and advised companies on business strategy and development. She has been founder of start-up previously and has also worked with several technology companies as part of a Venture Capital fund across various industry verticals.  She has worked in three other countries apart from the US – UK, Canada and India. Jas has also received a Commonwealth Scholarship offered by University of Cambridge from where she did her Masters, and also holds Bachelors in Engineering from Panjab University.

fields.name: ROHAN MALHOTRA
fields.title: INVESTMENT ASSOCIATE
fields.details: Rohan is an Investment Associate at Argo Digital, helping manage Argo’s venture investment portfolio. Previously, he was at Fahrenheit 212, a leading innovation and design consultancy, where he advised Fortune 500 companies on innovation and growth challenges through digital product strategy and design. Rohan holds a BS in Economics from Wharton and a BAS in Computer Science from the University of Pennsylvania.

fields.name: NICK MARTIN
fields.title: FUND MANAGER - INSURANCE
fields.details: Fund Manager of the Polar Capital Global Insurance Strategy which for 18 years has invested exclusively in the global (re)insurance industry. The Strategy has over £800m (as at 28 February 2017) focusing on the non-life insurance industry. Nick has a global network of contacts with a particular emphasis in London, the US and Bermuda. Nick is active in the InsurTech community including mentoring on two accelerator programmes. He has been recognised as a Top 50 Global InsurTech influencer by Insurtechnews.

fields.name: GEORGE MATHEW
fields.title: CHAIRMAN & CEO
fields.details: With 20 years of experience at growth-oriented technology startups as well as category leading software providers, such as Alteryx, Salesforce and SAP, Mathew has held a wide range of senior leadership positions, from driving company strategy to leading product management, development, sales and marketing teams. He joined Kespry, the leading aerial intelligence platform provider, in January 2017, where his focus is on driving the company’s growth into new markets and expanding the adoption of industrial insight Kespry’s autonomous drones make possible.

fields.name: MIKE MCGAVICK
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Mike McGavick serves as CEO of XL Group ltd, which provides insurance and reinsurance risk solutions globally under the XL Catlin brand. Previously, Mike was chairman, president and CEO of Safeco Corporation. Prior to joining Safeco, Mike spent six years with CNA Financial Corporation, where he held various senior positions, including president and CEO of the company’s largest commercial insurance unit.

fields.name: KATHY MELGAR
fields.title: AVP, PRODUCT DELIVERY
fields.details: Kathy Melgar is AVP, Product Delivery in the Retirement Solutions Division at Pacific Life, responsible for delivering competitive business applications and related technology services. She has over 25 years experience leading teams in application development and delivery, predominantly within insurance and finance companies. Her team is active in corporate innovation programs, using design thinking and agile concepts to engage with business partners to shape digital transformation, with Appian being one of their key enabling technologies.

fields.name: STEVEN MENDEL
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Steven has over 20 years’ diverse experience in the financial services industry - as a qualified actuary at AON and as a strategy consultant at McKinsey. Steven co-founded Bought By Many in 2012 to shift the balance of power in insurance. Since then, Bought By Many has been leading the insurtech vanguard in the UK with its focus on customer centricity: from product design, through the acquisition process to claims. Bought By Many is also present in a number of other countries. He is married with three kids, and has a passion for cycling, his sax, and for the charities he’s involved with.

fields.name: MATT MILLER
fields.title: FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: Matt Miller is the founder and CEO of Embroker, the tech-enabled and data driven commercial insurance broker. Matt is recognized as a key thought leader on insurance innovation and has been interviewed on the topic by The Wall Street Journal, Bloomberg, CNBC, and others. Previously, Matt worked for Hellman & Friedman, where he served on the boards of HUB International, Applied Systems and Renaissance Learning. Matt graduated from Duke University, and earned an MBA from Stanford GSB.

fields.name: KEITH MOORE
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Keith Moore is CEO of San Francisco-based CoverHound, a recognized insurance technology leader in both Personal and Commercial P&C Insurance. In 2016, Keith founded CyberPolicy, which leverages CoverHound’s leading distribution platform to bring industry-first Cybersecurity + Cyber Insurance options to the US online. In the past three years, Keith has raised over $77 million in capital. In 2017, Keith was a Northern California finalist for the Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year Award.

fields.name: YUSUF MUHAMMAD
fields.title: CO-FOUNDER & CDO
fields.details: Yusuf Muhammad is an award-winning inventor and industrial designer. He is Cofounder and CDO of Plumis Inc. which are reimagining the fire sprinkler for the connected smart home. Our flagship product, Automist Smartscan, is well established in the UK, IOT enabled, more efficient, and leaves less water damage than was possible with traditional approaches. It can enable tighter insurance product offerings, valuable data and better risk management.

fields.name: CAREY ANNE NADEAU
fields.title: FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: Carey Anne Nadeau is the founder and CEO of Open Data Nation, an innovative startup that capitalizes on the tremendous potential of administrative public records to save lives, reduce business risk, and improve financial efficiency. An award-winning MIT-trained city planner and urban data scientist, formerly of the Urban Institute and Brookings Institution, her work has been called transformational by the Open Data Institute (UK) and MIT and has been published in numerous outlets, including: the New York Times, The Atlantic, and GovTech Magazine.

fields.name: KYLE NAKATSUJI
fields.title: FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: Kyle is the cofounder and CEO of Clearcover, a new kind insurance company built from the ground up to provide customers with more, for less. Before founding Clearcover, Kyle was a founding member of American Family Ventures and a corporate attorney focused on emerging company business matters.

fields.name: BEN NARASIN
fields.title: VENTURE PARTNER
fields.details: Koichi is responsible for the creation of new experiences in the safety, security, and health of SOMPO customers by leveraging advanced digital technologies. Prior to joining SOMPO, Koichi led several start-ups as COO or CEO, including Midokura Corporation, UBIP, IP Infusion, ACCESS CO., LTD, and Lineo, Inc. In addition, spent 17 years at Mitsubishi Corporation driving global IT business development and strategic investments in the broadband/wireless market.

fields.name: ERIC NARCISCO
fields.title: FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: Eric is the founder of New York-based Effective Coverage, a digital insurance firm. In 2000, a devastating apartment fire set in motion the journey that led his firm to be a leader in the digital distribution of home and renters insurance.  Now, with over 50,000 policies sold and customers in 40 states, Eric focuses on the strategic vision of his firm and on sharing the lessons he’s learned with business leaders and entrepreneurs.

fields.name: TIM NGUYEN
fields.title: BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT MANAGER
fields.details: Tim Nguyen serves as Business Development and Strategic Partnerships manager for DJI, the world’s leader in consumer and commercial drones. Tim is responsible for discovering emerging markets and developing the solutions to integrate drones into the workflow of the world’s most forward-thinking companies. Tim has engaged in successful partnerships with companies such as GE, Facebook, Apple, and American Airlines within areas of media, inspection, and public safety.

fields.name: TED NICKEL
fields.title: COMMISSIONER OF INSURANCE
fields.details: Commissioner Nickel was appointed as Commissioner on January 3, 2011 by Wisconsin Governor Scott Walker. He currently serves as President of the National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC). He is also a member of the International Association of Insurance Supervisors (IAIS) and the Federal Advisory Committee on Insurance which serves as an advisory committee to the Federal Insurance Office.

fields.name: CHAD NITSCHKE
fields.title: CO-FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: After spending 15 years in executive positions at leading insurance carriers including Travelers & AXIS Capital, Chad left the traditional industry in early 2015 to launch Bunker, the first ever contract-related insurance marketplace, along with Insure.VC - an angel fund focused exclusively on Insurtech.  In addition to his background in the industry, he's now been on both sides of the fence, raising venture capital for Bunker, and investing in several insurtech startups.

fields.name: TREVOR NOHE
fields.title: PRESIDENT
fields.details: Trevor is the President of Inside Ventures whose mission is to help large brands find new customers through online lead generation and inside sales - primarily focused on insurance and education industries. Prior to Inside Ventures, Trevor worked at Deloitte Consulting and Five Elms Capital. Trevor received an MBA from the McCombs School of Business at the University of Texas at Austin and a B.S. in Finance and Marketing from the University of Kansas.

fields.name: MARTHA NOTARAS
fields.title: PARTNER
fields.details: Martha Notaras is a Partner at XL Innovate, a venture fund focused on insurtech.  She is on the board of Notion and a stealth data and analytics company, as well as a board observer at Cape Analytics.  Martha ran corporate development for DMG Information, and served on many boards including RMS. She worked in investment and commercial banking at Merrill Lynch and Credit Suisse. She earned her AB at Princeton and MBA at Harvard.

fields.name: ALEX PAPERNO
fields.title: CEO AND CO-FOUNDER
fields.details: With over 20 years of experience in software development, Alex specializes in computer security and game theory. Before becoming an entrepreneur, he was a professional poker player. Alex holds an MSc in Computer Science from LETI. He currently lives in St. Petersburg, Russia.

fields.name: TAMMY PASCUZZI
fields.title: STRATEGY DIRECTOR, INDIVIDUAL LIFE
fields.details: Tammy Pascuzzi is Strategy Director of Life Insurance at the Principal. She has over two decades of experience in the Financial Services industry. She has served in a variety of roles including project management, formal leadership and business unit strategy. Her responsibilities include researching innovative business opportunities and influencing strategic direction. Tammy is currently focused on advancing the use of data and analytics to grow revenue, build differentiating capabilities and engage the customer.

fields.name: ROEL PEETERS
fields.title: FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: Roel Peeters is a serial entrepreneur with over 20 years of startup experience ranging from enterprise software to consumer electronics and semiconductors. Before starting Roost, he was the co-founder of Ozmo Devices, a pioneer in low-power Wi-Fi. Prior to Ozmo’s acquisition by Atmel in 2012, Peeters successfully raised angel and venture funding rounds for the company. He also developed and executed Ozmo’s go-to- market plan with strategic partners including Intel and Microsoft. Furthermore, Peeters secured a key role for Ozmo in the standardization activities of Wi-Fi Direct technology.

fields.name: FRANK PEI
fields.title: INVESTMENT DIRECTOR
fields.details: Frank Pei is an Investment Director with JadeValue, investing in InsurTech/Fintech in China and globally. On top of the investment side, Jadevalue also runs a Fintech incubator in Shanghai and an Insurtech incubator in Beijing. Frank has deep knowledge of Artificial Intelligence and Big Data, and worked for leading Chinese FinTech companies such as Ant Financial, and CashBUS.

fields.name: JAIMIE PICKLES
fields.title: GENERAL MANAGER, INSURANCE
fields.details: Jaimie Pickles serves as General Manager of Jornaya's fast-growing insurance business.  Prior to Jornaya, he pioneered and led multiple online and mobile advertising companies, including InsWeb – the first online insurance marketplace, We Speak Insurance – the first insurance call generation company, and Canal Partner LLC – advisor and investor in early-stage advertising technology companies.  Jaimie holds the CPCU and ARM insurance designations and is a graduate of the University of Chicago.

fields.name: ANDREW PITZ
fields.title: INVESTMENT MANAGER
fields.details: Andrew Pitz is an investment manager at Transamerica Ventures, the global venture capital fund of Transamerica and AEGON that specializes in investing in insurtech, fintech and enterprise software companies. There he has led the firms’ investments in PolicyGenius, Digital Currency Group, Everplans, SmartAsset and Hixme. Prior to joining Transamerica Ventures, Andrew worked at KBJ Capital, an early-stage technology investment fund. Andrew is a 2009 graduate of Penn State University.

fields.name: SALLY POBLETE
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Sally has been a leader and innovator in the healthcare industry for over 20 years. She founded Wellthie in 2013 out of a deep passion for making health insurance more simple and approachable for consumers. She had a successful career leading product development at Anthem, one of the nation’s largest health insurance companies. Under Sally’s leadership, Wellthie has been named one of 30 Tech Startups with the Potential to Change the World.

fields.name: ARUN PRASAD
fields.title: PRINCIPAL IN OUR INSURANCE TECHNOLOGY PRACTICE
fields.details: Arun has more than 25 years of experience delivering technology and strategy consulting services to the Insurance industry. He currently serves as the Insurance Sector leader for Deloitte Digital. During his tenure at Deloitte, Arun has led multiple initiatives for clients looking to define and to implement disruptive technology solutions and increase operational efficiency through the use of technology. Arun recently led a multi-disciplinary project to launch a disruptive insurance start-up which utilizes a digital platform to engage with customers and prospects.

fields.name: DAN PRESTON
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Dan leads Metromile's vision to connect the world’s cars and revolutionize the services that support car ownership. Most recently, he was the co-founder and CTO of AisleBuyer, a mobile retail innovator that was acquired by Intuit in April 2012. Additionally, he has published several research papers in machine learning with applications such as astrophysics, remote sensing, and computer vision. Dan has a Master’s in Computer Science from Stanford University and a Bachelor’s in Computer Science from Brandeis University.

fields.name: CJ PRZYBYL
fields.title: PRESIDENT & CO-FOUNDER
fields.details: CJ Przybyl is the co-founder and President of Snapsheet, the auto insurance industry’s largest provider of virtual claims settlement solutions. CJ began working in mobile claims technology startups in 2011 when he led the pivot of BodyShopBids into Snapsheet, a pivot that was featured in Forbes Magazine as an example for future entrepreneurs.

fields.name: PAUL QI
fields.title: FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: Paul Qi, Founder and CEO of OKChexian. MA in Actuarial Science at Boston University, BE in Computer Engineering and BA in Law at University of Science and Technology of China.

fields.name: YANN RANCHERE
fields.title: PARTNER
fields.details: Yann is a Partner at Anthemis and brings in-depth knowledge of the trends shaping financial services innovation, as well as the startups addressing those and has international experience in a broad range of financial services. He contributes to the Principal Investment activities as well as advisory service. Prior to joining Anthemis, Yann worked as a consultant at Kurt Salmon in New York in various sectors and led the financial services innovation activity in the US.

fields.name: GIRISH RAO
fields.title: ENTERPRISE UNDERWRITING SOLUTIONS, BC&IT
fields.details: Girish Rao is the AVP of IT at Zurich North America responsible for Commercial Insurance underwriting solutions.  In this role, he leads a multi-billion dollar application portfolio, overseeing a large diverse team across multiple geographies. Over his 25 years in the IT industry, Girish has lead complex, large-scale, multi-million programs spanning strategy development, solution architecture & execution, business transformation and process automation. Girish’s breadth of experience spans the Insurance, Retail, Technology and Education sectors.

fields.name: ANDREW REAR
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE, DIGITAL PARTNERS
fields.details: Andrew Rear is the Chief Executive of Munich Re Digital Partners. He joined Munich Re in 2010, leading the Asia, Africa and UK life businesses until May 2016 when he took up his current role. Digital Partners is a global business working with, and investing in, start-ups, digital verticals and the sharing economy, with the ambition of building a more engaged proposition for insurance customers. Prior to joining Munich Re, Andrew was a partner and head of the EMEA insurance practice at Oliver Wyman.

fields.name: JOSH REZNICK
fields.title: FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: Josh Reznick has been a communications software developer since childhood and has been helping shape how businesses connect with customers for the past two decades. In 2009, Josh founded Datalot with the goal of creating a unified platform merging digital advertising with phone-based sales processes.    Josh is a lifelong resident of Brooklyn, NY, where he resides with his wife and two daughters.

fields.name: JESSICA RICHARD, PH.D.
fields.title: CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER
fields.details: Jessica Richard completed a Ph.D. in Biochemistry & Molecular Biology. Recognizing that there is a substantial degree of overlap between academic research and business, she decided to implement her training in data analysis, communication, and marketing in a business arena.

fields.name: CHRISTIAN RIEPE
fields.title: INNOVATION SCOUT
fields.details: I’m an Innovation Scout for ERGO Digital Ventures and Executive in Residence at Startup Boot Camp London. My background is 17 years of insurance and marketing experience. As innovation scout I identify new technologies that are related to the insurance industry with a strong focus on “bring innovation alive”. Before joining ERGO Digital Ventures I was heading an international inhouse consulting unit for ERGO Direkt.

fields.name: ANDREW ROSE
fields.title: PRESIDENT AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Andrew Rose is the President and CEO of Compare.com, the leading car insurance comparison website in the United States. Compare.com was founded on the belief that shopping for car insurance should be easier. Andrew is a graduate of the Darden School of Business and has worked in a number of insurance companies prior to Compare.com, including Progressive, Countrywide and Elephant Auto Insurance. Andrew lives in Richmond, Virginia with his wife and three children.

fields.name: DANIEL ROSS
fields.title: PARTNER
fields.details: Daniel looks after venture activities for Yellowwoods, identifying investment and strategic partnership opportunities for the Group’s insurance portfolio. Yellowwoods represents insurance businesses across sub-Saharan Africa, Australia, SE Asia and Europe covering life, P&C, brokerage/affiliate and price comparison. We add most value at proof of concept stage onwards and have a record of building large, international businesses over the long-term. Daniel has experience in corporate finance, wealth management and start-ups as founding partner of a UK crowdfunder. He holds an MBA from London Business School.

fields.name: ERIK ROSS
fields.title: HEAD OF NATIONWIDE VENTURES
fields.details: Erik's background is an eclectic mix of technology startups and large financial institutions. His past experiences include leading Nationwide’s disruptive innovation group, serving as North Carolina's first Chief Digital Officer, as well as holding several executive roles at tech startups and Fortune 500 companies. He was also an Executive-in Residence at the MIT Media Lab. In addition, he likes to relate nearly any situation to an episode of Seinfeld.

fields.name: RYAN RUGG
fields.title: HEAD OF NORTH AMERICA
fields.details: Ryan Rugg is Head of North America for R3, spearheading business development focused on asset managers and the insurance industry.  She is responsible for the launch of R3’s DLT Centre of Excellence for global (re)insurers, which is redefining the foundations of insurance by harnessing the power of collaborative networks, as they deploy DLT at scale.  Prior to R3 Ryan worked for Morgan Stanley and JPMorgan where she had extensive experience in financial services.

fields.name: JON SABES
fields.title: CHAIRMAN AND CEO
fields.details: Jon R. Sabes, co-founder and Chief Executive Officer of GWG Holdings, is a financial professional with over 20 years of experience in the fields of finance, venture capital, business development, managerial operations, and federal taxation. In 2016, he was the first insurance executive to identify the application of epigenetics and genomics to life insurance and has been leading GWG Life in repositioning itself as an insurtech disruptor ever since that time.

fields.name: ALI SAFAVI
fields.title: DIRECTOR, INSURTECH
fields.details: Ali Safavi is the Founder and Director of Plug and Play Insurance, the largest insurtech focused startup innovation platform in partnership with over 40 global insurance institutions including Munich Re, Aon, USAA, State Farm, SOMPO Digital Lab, Farmers, Nationwide, Allianz, Travelers, Aviva, AIG. Ali is also a Principal at Plug and Play Ventures, the venture arm of Plug and Play Tech Center where he invests in startups across multiple industries.

fields.name: RANVIR SAGGU
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Ranvir has always had a strong focus on how technology can improve insurance.  He strongly believes the new wave of digital change can deliver more appropriate products for customers with improved profitability across the insurance value chain. He has extensive experience across most areas of insurance (composite and direct insurers, MGAs, brokers and claims TPAs) having held senior executive roles at businesses such as Fosun Insurance, Towergate, Direct Line Group.

fields.name: NICOLE SANCHEZ
fields.title: INVESTMENT PARTNER
fields.details: Named “One of the Most Powerful Women in NYC Tech” by Refinery 29, Nicole is on a mission to ensure the brilliance and scale of tech are leveraged to solve real problems.  An Investment Partner at X Factor Ventures and Founder and CEO of CFSI and JP Morgan backed fintech startup, Credit Hero, Nicole is a graduate of Harvard Business School and Harvard College. She has been named A Mogul Changing The Game" by Marie Claire and has been featured in Fast Company, TechCrunch, Forbes, Essence, Elle, Ebony, and Forbes.

fields.name: CHRIS SANDILANDS
fields.title: PARTNER
fields.details: Chris Sandilands is a Founding Partner at Oxbow Partners, a boutique strategy and M&A consulting firm serving the insurance industry.  Oxbow Partners are InsurTech thought leaders and have advised several of the world’s leading insurers and brokers on the topic.  For example, the firm was the sole advisor to Munich Re on the strategy, design and implementation of its Digital Partners division in 2016.

fields.name: AYAN SARKAR
fields.title: VP, BUSINESS OWNER, DIGITAL CHANNEL, DIGITAL CHANNEL PRODUCT MARKETING
fields.details: Ayan Sarkar is the business lead for Guidewire’s products and services for digital products and customer journeys. Previously he had 15 years of experience serving insurance companies at both McKinsey & Company and Deloitte, with a focus on digital and advanced analytics. Ayan founded and ran the Spark Group, a for-profit education technology company. He has an MBA from the MIT Sloan School of Management and a B. Tech from IIT Kanpur.

fields.name: BARNEY SCHAUBLE
fields.title: MANAGING PARTNER
fields.details: Mr. Schauble has been a Managing Partner at Nephila since 2004, in Bermuda until 2010 and now in San Francisco. His primary responsibilities include investor relations, strategic and business development projects (including insuretech) and oversight of Nephila’s weather strategy. He served as a Director of The Climate Corporation (2007-20012), MetroMile (2009-2011), and Advisen (2014-2016), and is Vice Chair of the board of Ceres.

fields.name: ROB SCHIMEK
fields.title: EVP AND CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER OF COMMERCIAL
fields.details: Robert S. Schimek oversees AIG’s commercial insurance businesses worldwide. Previously, he served as CEO of the Americas, CEO of EMEA and CFO for global property casualty. Before joining AIG, Mr. Schimek was a partner at Deloitte & Touche L.L.P. Mr. Schimek is a C.P.A. He earned his M.B.A. from Wharton School of Business and his undergraduate degree from Rider University. Mr. Schimek is a member of the Board of Directors of BritishAmerican Business, the Board of Directors of the American Insurance Association and Chairman of the Rider University Board of Trustees.

fields.name: ALEX SCHWARZKOPF
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Alex Schwarzkopf is the CEO and co-founder of Pillar Technologies. Pillar was recently part of the first Techstars IoT program, won the Forbes Change the World competition and was named best Insurtech startup at Plug and Play. Prior to launching his startup, Alex worked at Tesla Motors in Silicon Valley, and he spent time designing scalable wireless technologies for sub-Saharan Africa.

fields.name: GEORG SCHWEGLER
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Georg Schwegler manages AEGON’s corporate venture activities as CEO of Transamerica Ventures Fund http://www.transamericaventures.com/), a role he began in January 2014. His experience in the corporate venture industry stems from T-Venture, where he joined in October 2000 and served as CEO from 2005 until 2013. He also served as adviser for the German government. Georg holds a PhD from the University of Cologne/Germany in Business Administration.

fields.name: SATADRU SENGUPTA
fields.title: GENERAL MANAGER, INSURANCE
fields.details: Satadru Sengupta, General Manager, Insurance at DataRobot, is a practicing data scientist for more than ten years. Before DataRobot, Satadru led the Global Distribution Analytics at AIG Science Team and previously worked with Liberty Mutual Insurance and Deloitte Consulting. In his current role as the GM Insurance, Satadru runs the Insurance Practice at DataRobot where he spends 50% time on strategy, thought leadership, and client advisory and remaining time on hands-on work in the front-line.

fields.name: ANDREA SILVELLO
fields.title: CO-FOUNDER & CFO
fields.details: Andrea Silvello is a business & strategy consultant and insurtech entrepreneur. He has over 15 years of experience in business & strategy consultancy in international firms (BCG and Bain & Company) and is the founder and MD of a business & strategy boutique focusing on innovation, digital strategy and corporate finance (Business Support). He has founded InsurTech start-ups focusing on micro-insurance, health & home insurance and eHealth services (Neosurance and Digital Tech).

fields.name: ANGELA STRANGE
fields.title: PARTNER
fields.details:
Partner
Andreessen Horowitz

fields.name: DENNIS SILVIA
fields.title: PRESIDENT
fields.details: Dennis Silvia is the President of Cedar Consulting LLC, a captive insurance consulting firm. He has 25 plus years of experience in alternative insurance mechanisms. Dennis holds AAI and CPCU insurance designations and has an MA degree in Management from Regent University completing his thesis project on Alternative Insurance Programs. His consulting practice focuses on the integration of alternative risk program structures to assist in reaching enterprise-wide risk management goals.

fields.name: JAMES SIMINOFF
fields.title: CEO
fields.details: In 2000 Jamie founded Your First Step, the company developed global wholesale Voice over IP networks in developing countries including, Eastern Europe, Latin America and Africa, the company later merged with Nobel Ltd. Becoming the world’s largest online phone card seller. In 2005 Jamie was inspired by the archaic nature of voicemail to found the world’s first voicemail-to- text company, PhoneTag. In September of 2009 PhoneTag was acquired by Ditech Networks for $17 million. Jamie currently is the CEO and Chief Inventor of Ring, the doorbell for the smartphone which has raised $100 million from Kleiner Perkins, Sir Richard Branson and other distinguished investors. Jamie holds a Bachelor of Science in entrepreneurship from Babson College.

fields.name: WAYNE SLAVIN
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Wayne Slavin is the CEO of Sure, an Insurtech startup whose platform is providing services to more than 30 of the world largest carriers. Prior to Sure he was the VP of Product Management at Tapingo, TechCrunch’s Most Innovative Company of 2013. His other past projects and companies include NetStumbler, an app with more than 1.5+ billion downloads, the Barnes & Noble Nook, Buddy Media, and BackupRight the SaaS company he sold in 2012.

fields.name: DAN SMITH
fields.title: MANAGING PARTNER
fields.details: Dan is Managing Partner of Exponential Ventures, an early-stage investment fund and incubator, in partnership with Anthemis Group, thematically focused on Financial Wellness. We invest across the fintech, insuretech and healthtech markets in Europe and the U.S.  Board member at ABAKA and investor & advisor of Startupbootcamp Insuretech.  Background in Strategy Consulting and Sales/BD leadership across EMEA and TMT sectors for Monitor Deloitte and IBM.

fields.name: MARK SMITH
fields.title: VP & Partner, Financial Services, Digital, Big Data & Analytics, & Strategy Service Line
fields.details: Leading Strategy & Transformation for Insurance clients. Focus on InsureTech Strategy & Ventures, Digital Strategy, Analytics & CIO Advisory.

fields.name: ROBIN SMITH
fields.title: CEO & CO-FOUNDER
fields.details: Robin’s desire to bolster confidence in purchase decisions by online consumers led her to found WeGoLook, a crowdsourced verification platform utilized across every industry. She has an extensive background in sales, beginning her career with the Washington Post and advancing to regional management positions. Robin then started a consulting firm which transitioned automotive dealerships into internet sales. Her e-commerce experience combined with her early entry into the sharing economy make her a unique voice.

fields.name: GAVIN SOUTHWELL
fields.title: CEO & PRESIDENT
fields.details: A strategic visionary and recognized leader, Gavin Southwell has served as HIIQ’s CEO and President since 2016. With over 15 years of executive leadership experience, he has been instrumental in the company's record success in driving growth and controlling costs. He previously served as COO at Cooper Gay Swett & Crawford and as Risk Manager for Beazley and has a proven track record in delivering enhanced performance with a customer focused approach.

fields.name: RUSTY SPROAT
fields.title: FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: A serial entrepreneur, Rusty is passionate about leveraging innovative technologies to transform how consumers purchase, interact and value insurance. As a licensed insurance professional, Rusty owned three agencies before fulfilling his vision of launching an InsurTech company. Inspired by Buster—his loyal Boston Terrier—and deep understanding of the industry, Rusty launched Figo, the first technology-based pet insurance company. Rusty is often a keynote speaker at InsurTech events, sharing his expertise on innovation and Figo’s no-stack approach to technology architecture.

fields.name: JULIAN STAINTON
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Julian has been CEO of the WPA Group, recognised throughout the UK as the pioneer in customer service excellence powered by unrelenting clarity of leadership and technology leverage, for more than 30 years. As an authorised UK health-insurer, WPA has been at the forefront of each wave of tech advances - now, especially, machine-learning and fully automated underwriting and administration in the staggeringly complex medical environment. WPA's own development of DELOS and Precision Analytics now leads the way for managing multiplex customer and provider relationships with quality, accuracy and certainty.

fields.name: MATT STREISFELD
fields.title: PRINCIPAL
fields.details: Matt Streisfeld is a Principal at Oak HC/FT and joined the firm in 2015. Matt focuses on growth equity and early-stage venture opportunities exclusively in financial services technology.  He is a Board Observer on Insureon, Trov, and Urjanet. Prior to joining Oak HC/FT, Matt was a Vice President with LLR Partners. Matt was previously a Senior Associate at Lightyear Capital. Matt was also an Associate at Keefe, Bruyette & Woods. Matt graduated from The George Washington University.

fields.name: DAVID STUBBS
fields.title: CEO & CO-FOUNDER
fields.details: David is a serial entrepreneur in claims services and is passionate in his belief that to be effective; any solution must be based on meeting the needs of the customer – emotional as well as contractual. For the past 18 months David has as its CEO led RightIndem’s mission to outperform the existing models in claims. In doing so RightIndem have proved that when properly planned for, outstanding customer service can be delivered digitally at a far lower cost to the insurer than existing telephone based claims models.

fields.name: JOHN SWIGART
fields.title: CO-FOUNDER & CEO
fields.details: John is the co-founder and CEO of Pie Insurance, where he leads a team of experienced technology and insurance industry veterans. Prior to founding Pie, John led the finance team at Esurance for three years before becoming CMO and growing the company from $50 million to $1.3 billion in premium in 2013 when he left. Most recently, he led the direct distribution channel at a small business lender.

fields.name: MATTHEW SYDNEY
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Matt Sydney is the CEO of Picwell, a Philadelphia-based healthcare technology company. He has 20 years of experience helping health plans and employers adopt successful health benefits programs. Prior to joining Picwell, Matt was EVP of Sales and Marketing at HealthEquity, a leading provider of health savings accounts. Previously, he held senior positions at LifeCare and IntelliHealth, an Aetna company. He is a graduate of Emory University and the University of Michigan.

fields.name: MOSHE TAMIR
fields.title: GLOBAL HEAD OF DIGITAL TRANSFORMATION
fields.details: Moshe is Global Head of Digital Transformation at Generali, one of the world’s largest insurance companies. Prior to this, Moshe was Deputy CEO and CMO of Migdal Insurance, Israel’s largest insurance company. Moshe was a lecturer at Tel Aviv university’s MBA program on human center innovation in financial services and a board member in Anthemis group. Moshe started his career at Intel Israel. He has deep experience with international innovation and is passionate about reinventing financial services.

fields.name: NINO TARANTINO
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details:
Nino Tarantino is the North American CEO of Octo Telematics, the global leader insurance telematics provider. Under his leadership North American operations exceeded 1.5 million connected users just 4 years after its launch in 2011. Nino is also Board Director of the Connected Vehicle Trade Association (CVTA) and is a frequent speaker at industry events on subjects such as usage based insurance, telematics and crash and claims management. He was previously General Manager of Acotel USA, operating in the mobile premium content and value added services sector and VP of Business Development at Anoto Group AB, a global leader in digital writing solutions. 
Connect with him on Linkedin or follow him on Twitter @ninotarantino.

fields.name: FRANCOIS THERON
fields.title: CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER
fields.details: Francois joined Discovery Holdings in March 2000. During his tenure at Discovery he has been responsible for Discovery Health’s Operations, Vice President for Destiny Health – rebranded as Vitality (USA), involved in the UK operations of Prudential Health post the acquisition of Standard Life Healthcare by Discovery Holdings in the UK - rebranded as VitalityHealth, VitalityLife and involved in the start-up of the fastest growing short term Insurer in South Africa called Discovery Insure. Francois was selected as Discovery’s Leader of the Year in 2004 and holds a Masters Degree in Business Management.

fields.name: WES THOMPSON
fields.title: PRESIDENT & CEO
fields.details: Wes Thompson became President and CEO of M Financial Group on September 1, 2017. He oversees all strategic and operational aspects of M, including development of resources and services designed to enhance Member Firm success. Prior to M Financial, Wes was CEO of Emerge, which he founded in January 2015, with the goal of making protection from emergencies accessible to everyone.

fields.name: JEFF TO
fields.title: GLOBAL HEAD OF INSURANCE
fields.details: Jeff is the Global Head of Insurance at Salesforce, partnering with top financial services companies and innovative solution providers to re-think digital experiences for employees and customers. He was an Innovator Award Winner at IBM and played executive roles in IBM's growth initiatives, including Smarter Cities, Smarter Healthcare, and the Retail Emerging Business Opportunity Group. He also founded InsurTech Garage, an innovation center showcasing technologies developed by leading insurers, startups, and VCs.

fields.name: JEFF TOMPKINS
fields.title: FOUNDER & PRESIDENT
fields.details: Jeff Tompkins is Founder and President of AdvisorConnect, a NYC-based technology company focused on enabling the advisor of the future with industry-specific, best practice-driven online tools. Jeff has experience in three prior start-ups. His previous startup, SocialPicks, won best startup in the New York Stock Exchange’s Big Startup competition.  Jeff completed his graduate studies at Oxford University where he studied Politics and Philosophy as a US Marshall Scholar and he graduated magna cum laude in Government from Cornell University.

fields.name: MARKUS TRADT
fields.title: IT ARCHITECT
fields.details: Markus Tradt is an IT Architect at Munich Re in Germany. He leads the global blockchain initiative at Munich Re and is a technical architect for B3i. Markus joined Munich Re in 2002 and has been responsible for IT topics around asset management, accounting, regulatory reporting, and underwriting systems. He has also been active in the blockchain community. Markus graduated from Munich School of Philosophy S.J. and holds a master’s degree in Philosophy.

fields.name: BYRON UDELL, JD, CLU, CFP, CHFC
fields.title: PRESIDENT AND CEO
fields.details: Byron is the founder and CEO of AccuQuote, one of the nation’s largest and most respected life insurance quoting and brokerage agencies. His business exploded back in the mid 1990’s as he was one of the first to utilize the web as a marketing platform. His firm has placed over $100 billion of life insurance in force and is always looking for new technologies to streamline the process for consumers.

fields.name: KATHLEEN UTECHT
fields.title: MANAGING PARTNER
fields.details: Kathleen Utecht is a managing partner of Core Innovation Capital, a leading venture capital firm investing in financial services startups empowering everyday Americans. Portfolio companies include CoverHound, Oportun, Mirador, and Mosaic. Kat's previous work includes a mix of financial services (GE Capital, Raymond James Financial Service Group), operating (co-founder/CEO of Green Rock Entertainment) and investing (Comcast Ventures) experience. Kat’s insights are cited regularly by numerous publications including Forbes, Inc, and the Wall Street Journal.

fields.name: SABINE VANDERLINDEN
fields.title: MANAGING DIRECTOR
fields.details: Sabine is the CEO of Startupbootcamp InsurTech, the leading independent European accelerator for insurance technology startups. Sabine cultivates the expertise of renown insurers, investors and mentors to bring cohorts of startups to market within a three-month period. She brings extensive operational and growth expertise gleaned from her corporate innovation and acceleration activities working with 100s of financial institutions. Sabine is a co-editor of the first crowdsourced InsurTECH Book, planned for publication by Wiley early 2018.

fields.name: JEAN-CHARLES VELGE
fields.title: CO-FOUNDER
fields.details: Jean-Charles Velge Co-founded Qover in 2016 with Quentin Colmant. He spent his whole career in the private equity industry, half in Europe and half in Hong Kong. He started as a consultant at Bain & Company, then joined the largest Benelux fund NPM Capital before joining Redhorse in Hong Kong. Jean-Charles is 34 years old, graduated in Economic Sciences, holds a master’s in Finance and an MBA.

fields.name: ROBIN VON HEIN
fields.title: FOUNDER AND CEO
fields.details: Robin von Hein founded simplesurance group in 2012, after he had worked in the insurance sector for more than 10 years. He realized that digitalization was an alien concept to the industry and envisioned an easy and transparent way to purchase insurance. With the technology solutions of simplesurance he has changed the way people see and buy insurance. After 5 years, German Finance Magazine Handelsblatt counts him to the 100 most innovative people who drive digital progress forward.

fields.name: TROY VOSSELLER
fields.title: CO-FOUNDER
fields.details: Troy is a Co-Founder of gener8tor, a nationally ranked startup accelerator with programs in Milwaukee, Madison and Minneapolis. To date, gener8tor’s 54 alumni have cumulatively raised more than $140M in follow-on financing. In addition, Troy and gener8tor organize the annual OnRamp Insurance Conference focused on connecting insurance corporations, investors and startups each Spring in Chicago.

fields.name: SCOTT WALCHEK
fields.title: CEO
fields.details: Scott is the Founder & CEO of Trov, the world's first on-demand insurance platform. He is a serial entrepreneur with over 20 years of experience building great technology companies including being a member of the founding management team of Macromedia - IPO 1993 (acquired by Adobe), co-lead investor and founding director of Baidu, founder & CEO of C2B Technologies (acquired by Inktomi - now Yahoo!) and founder & CEO of DebtMarket (acquired by Intercontinental Exchange).

fields.name: ASSAF WAND
fields.title: CEO & CO-FOUNDER
fields.details: Assaf is the Co-Founder and CEO of Hippo, a new kind of insurance company that uses modern technology to provide a simpler process, smarter coverage, and a completely new approach to how we care for our homes. In the past Assaf started and ran Sabi (sold), built a Telecom business in developing countries and was a consultant with McKinsey focused on financial institutions and an investor with Intel Capital.

fields.name: YING WANG
fields.title: MANAGING DIRECTOR

Fosun Group has $150B Asset under management, and through its insurance & multi-industry business, generates over $20B investable assets annually. Ms. Wang leads Fosun’s high-tech investments in the US, with focus on FinTech and pioneering technology. Prior to Kinzon, she served as Executive Director at NLVC since 2006.

fields.name: BOB WASSERMAN
fields.title: SVP, DIGITAL TRANSFORMATION
fields.details: As Senior Vice President, Digital Transformation, Bob’s responsibilities include leading Web, Mobile, Social Media, User Experience and marketing operations functions for Allstate. Bob joined Allstate in July, 2009, and his background includes over 25 years of experience in sales, marketing, Internet commerce and operations across a variety of industries. Prior to joining Allstate, Bob held senior roles at a number of companies, including AT&T, Ameritech Corporation and W.W. Grainger, Inc.

fields.name: MITCHELL WASSERMAN
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Mitchell co-founded Oceanwide and has led the company as CEO since its inception. At Oceanwide, Mitchell has focused on designing and promoting the company’s market leading insurance SaaS solutions. Prior to Oceanwide, Mitchell co-founded Bizware Computer Systems. Mitchell has also co-founded several other entrepreneurial ventures in technology, real estate and hydro-power, and sits on the board of several companies. Mitchell holds degrees in Software Engineering and Public Accountancy from McGill University.

fields.name: DENNY WEINBERG
fields.title: CEO
fields.details: Denny Weinberg is CEO of Hixme, a disruptive company at the intersection of Digital Health & FinTech. As CEO of Hixme, and former executive of WellPoint (now Anthem), Denny has created a disruptive technology leader in the new era of worker-owned health benefits. Previously Denny held a variety of business consulting positions with Touché-Ross and Company (currently Deloitte & Touché) in Chicago focusing on Financial and Operational turnarounds in Healthcare, Manufacturing & Insurance.

fields.name: PAT WILSON
fields.title: PARTNER
fields.details: Pat is a repeat entrepreneur with nearly a decade of investment experience. Prior to joining Route 66, Pat was a Vice President with Quona Capital, a growth-stage venture fund where he focused on FinTech in emerging markets. At Route 66, Pat brings together his entrepreneurial, direct investment and global FinTech experience to source, evaluate and lead new venture investments as well as mentor and support Route 66’s existing portfolio.

fields.name: SCOTT D. WOLLNEY
fields.title: PRESIDENT & CEO
fields.details: Since December 2010, Mr. Wollney is President/CEO and a director of Atlas Financial Holdings, Inc., a publicly listed specialty commercial automobile insurance company (NASDAQ: AFH). Mr. Wollney has more than 25 years of experience in P&C insurance as an executive and co-founder of both insurance companies as well as brokerage operations, holds an MBA from Northwestern University's Kellogg School of Management and a Bachelor of Arts degree from the University of Illinois.

fields.name: MATTHEW WONG
fields.title: SENIOR RESEARCH ANALYST
fields.details: Matthew Wong is senior research analyst at CB Insights, where he produces data analysis and research on startup and venture capital trends across emerging industries. Matthew’s industry research and analysis have been featured in The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, The Financial Times, and Bloomberg among other major media outlets. Matthew launched and currently manages Insurance Tech Insights, a data-­driven resource  and newsletter covering innovation and technology for executives and tech investors in the global insurance industry.

fields.name: TELISA YANCY
fields.title: CHIEF MARKETING OFFICER
fields.details: Telisa Yancy is recognized in the business community as a revolutionary thinker and a transformational leader with a keen focus on customer-driven business models that leverage technology and design to gain efficiency and deliver delight to customers. Ms. Yancy is a member of the American Family Insurance senior leadership team, where she serves as the Chief Marketing Officer of the Fortune 300 company, leading all marketing, customer experience, consumer insights, communications and digital functions. Ms. Yancy is listed as a 2017 AdAge Women to Watch and a 2016 Ebony Magazine Power 100 Honoree. Ms. Yancy is a native of Chicago, IL and holds a BS from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign and an MBA from Northwestern University’s Kellogg Graduate School of Management.

fields.name: LIU YANG
fields.title: GENERAL MANAGER
fields.details: Liu Yang is the General Manager of JadeValue's InsurTech incubator in Beijing, the first InsurTech focused incubator in China, where he is dedicated to build the next generation of insurance innovation to meet the changing needs of the consumers. With a degree in Electronic Engineering from Tsinghua University, Liu Yang has rich diverse experience as an investor and over 15 years in the communications and insurance industry.

fields.name: HOWARD YEH
fields.title: CEO & CO-FOUNDER
fields.details: Howard Yeh is the CEO and co-founder of HealthCare.com, an online healthcare company founded in 2014 and built around connecting consumers with coverage options. HealthCare.com is a leading provider of performance-driven advertising for health insurance and Medicare marketers. Howard previously co-founded ContactUs.com (acquired in 2015 by WorkWave) and was COO and co-founder of BrokersWeb (acquired in 2011). He began his career as an investment banker at Merrill Lynch and a venture capitalist at VantagePoint Capital.

fields.name: DUSTIN YODER
fields.title: CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
fields.details: Dustin Yoder is an InsurTech entrepreneur, visionary, and product builder. The son of a top Silicon Valley insurance broker and InsurTech entrepreneur, Dustin has been primed to make a splash in the insurance space from birth.  In 2012, Dustin formed Sureify, an InsureTech start-up company providing a full-stack platform for life insurance clients. Sureify has built a web and mobile engagement platform, “LifeTime”, to manage the relationship between life insurance carriers, agents, and the customer.

fields.name: ZIA ZAMAN
fields.title: SVP AND CHIEF INNOVATION OFFICER
fields.details: Zia Zaman joined MetLife in July 2014 as the Chief Innovation Officer for the Asia region. In his role, Zia is responsible for leading LumenLab, the industry-first innovation center, and steering the innovation agenda for the Asia region. Zia holds an MBA from Stanford’s GSB. He also has an undergraduate bachelor’s of science degree from MIT in electrical engineering and a master’s of science degree in operations research, also from MIT. Zia is married with two children and lives in Singapore.

fields.name: LAURA ZIMMERMAN
fields.title: EXECUTIVE VICE PRESIDENT AND CHIEF MARKETING OFFICER
fields.details: Laura Zimmerman is executive vice president and chief marketing officer for Fidelity Life and Efinancial businesses. In this role, she leads customer acquisition, data and predictive analytics, branding and communications. Zimmerman is also responsible for driving the firm’s digital customer experience and strategic partnerships. Prior to Fidelity Life, Zimmerman, held senior marketing and strategy positions with Guardian Life Insurance Company, Allstate, and Legg Mason. Zimmerman earned her bachelor’s degree from Dartmouth College and her MBA from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.

fields.name: RICK ZULLO
fields.title: PRINCIPAL
fields.details: Rick is a Principal at Lightbank, a $200m early-stage venture firm with over 100 portfolio companies to date. Rick focuses on enterprise tech investments and serves as a Board Member for Snapsheet, Riskmatch and Benchprep. In addition to his role at Lightbank, Rick is on the investment committee for NUSeeds and a mentor at Techstars and First Growth Accelerator. Rick received his MBA with honors from Columbia and graduated from the University of Richmond.

fields.name: WILL NICKLAS
fields.title: VICE PRESIDENT, MARKETING, COMMUNICATIONS, AND SHARED SERVICES

fields.takeaway: Cambrian explosion of InsureTech in the past 12 months…but still no “MGA in a box”
Insurance could move to either a “toothbrush” or a “dentist visit” model
Next 12 months will hopefully see increased clarity in impact of technologies (AI, blockchain, APIs)
A lot has changed in insurance in the last 20 years, but a lot remains “low tech” or “no tech”
Six technologies are already advancing insurance: Computer vision, Conversational AI,  Sensors, Blockchain, Robotics,  and Genomics
The nature of risk is changing, as we are creating a new, interconnected cyber-physical system
Insurance products and the industrial logic will look dramatically different, while new roles will replace existing ones
Autonomous cars will transform car insurance progressively and will require adequate products (e.g., blend of product and personal liability)
MGA vs. full-stack depends on what a startup wants to accomplish: disruption in pricing and distribution does not require being a carrier
In Metromile’s first years, insurance veterans made sure all groups respected and understood each other and everything was built to be regulator-friendly, which was critical for success
Satellite imagery and advanced analytics can fill existing data gaps
After the Tianjin explosion, Orbital was able to estimate losses by looking at pre and post imagery
With 3-4 engineers and 6-12 months, Orbital believes it could predict which houses are likely to be destroyed by hurricanes
Our data sources will change significantly from government to real-time data via imagery and sensors delivered via internet
